Monsieur D., âgé de 53 ans, est à sa première demande de crédit depuis qu'il est membre de U-IMCEC en 2007. Il compte avec ce financement réfectionner une de ses voitures pour mieux tirer profits du business.
texts.en:
Mr. Thiéyacine D. has been a bus driver for the past 20 years. He is very well known in the business and has been one of the leading drivers of the city of Thies since 1996. He is married with four children, and owns two vehicles (transit buses) that are used for urban transport through Thies. Mr. D., who is 53 years old, is requesting a first loan from U-IMCEC, of which he is a member since 2007. This loan will allow him to overhaul one of his vehicles and profit more from his business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: overhaul his transit bus

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat H., 33 years old and married, is the loving mother of two children. She lives in Dushanbe and owns a small vending store in the local market. For about two years Sharofat has been selling the national coat “Chapan” for men and national dresses for women. Her store is well-known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted merchandise at affordable prices, and her profits have increased considerably since she started her business. Sharofat has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche, a skill that helped her start her business and make it successful. Today, in order to increase inventory and sales, she is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 39 years old and married with five children aged 5 to 13 years. All of them are attending school. He is a farmer in Chemororochi Town in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been in this business for 12 years selling his milk in the local market. Ali is also a carpenter offering his carpentry services in the local market. He has been in this business since 1998. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs 46,800 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. In the future he intends to diversify his personal farm and acquire four other dairy cows.

Ali is grateful to Juhudi because his family is now enjoying milk through the dairy cow he acquired with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne  36 ans,   5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels les céréales, l’habillement, les articles de boutique, les condiments alimentaires, les  cosmétiques  etc.                                                                                     
Ces femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur premier prêt de groupe et Koumba C. qui est dans le créneau des condiments alimentaires compte utiliser son prêt pour  se constituer un stock  de divers condiments alimentaires, le plus généralement à Bamako auprès des grossistes  et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Konobougou et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.                                 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
All the women of the group Tièssiri average 36 years of age and five children each living in traditional extended families in Konobougou City, sub-prefecture of Barouéli, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another though ties of community and kinship. And they do business in a variety of goods, such as grains, clothing, boutique items, condiments, etc. The women in the group are on their first group loan. Koumba C., whose niche is in condiments, intends to use her loan for building up a stock of various condiments, mostly in Bamako, from wholesalers. She sells locally, at the Konobougou market and at the surrounding fairs, and she accepts cash and credit from a customer base composed essentially of women and men. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying condiments

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
El señor Cosme A. M., tiene la edad 63 años con su señora esposa habita en la Comarca San José de los Ríos, ellos tiene 5 hijos, casados que se desempeñan en diferentes actividades, el señor Cosme se dedica a la agricultura y cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en este rubro.

El productor ha tenido la experiencia de cultivar diferente variedades de plantas y frutos, uno de los obstáculos que se le han presentado en el pasado, es el alza de los insumos agrícolas en los últimos años. Tomando en cuenta que sus tierras se encuentran en mal estado, es necesario hacer una fertilización foliar, con mejoras a las condiciones agrónomas y fitosanitarias, de tal manera que solicita un préstamo para la compra de matariles agrícolas, fertilizantes y pésticidas para brindarle un mantenimiento òptimo a los cultivos, y aporté a un aumento a las ventas, mejoras a su nivel de vida, y recursos economicos para proyecto a futuro que favorezca a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Cosme A. M., 63, lives with his wife in San José de los Ríos; they have 5 children who are married and in various occupations. Cosme is a farmer and has over 20 years experience in this line of work. He has grown a variety of fruits and plants. One of the obstacles he’s faced in the past is the rise in prices of farming supplies the last few years. Because his fields are in poor condition it’s necessary to apply fertilizers in order to improve soil and plant health. For this reason, he’s asking for funds to buy farming supplies, fertilizers and pesticides to provide optimum care to his crops in order to realize increased sales, improved living conditions and to have financial resources for future projects that will benefit the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Savaet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savaet V. is a 28-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Thmei village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Samnang Him, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. Aside from farming, Mrs. Savaet V. is also raises pigs at home and is able to earn a small income to support her family.

For her pig business, Mrs. Savaet V. decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets to raise. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farm crops.

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is two years old. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy five piglets plus fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Moises Israel

texts.pt:
Moisés Israel M. nasceu no Distrito de Chongoene, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos cuja as idades Ja não se lembra, mas os 2 mais novos vão a escola. Fez somente 1ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Gaza para Boane com seu pai ainda menor de idade. Actualmente trabalha como guarda segurança na empresa SOCEL ha mais de 24 anos, onde também possui um negócio próprio de compra e venda de cobertores. Neste negócio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 22.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que Ja solicitou crédito nesta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 13.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cobertores, duvetes e lençóis para aumentar a sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar a sua residência e construir um estabelecimento comercial mais condigno.
texts.en:
Moisés Israel M. was born in Chongoene District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has 6 children whose ages he does not remember right now, but the two youngest go to school. Moisés only finished first grade and did not continue with school because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else. He left Gaza to move to Boane with his father when he was still young. Moisés currently works as a security guard at SOCEL, where he has worked for more than 24 years. He also has a business buying and selling bedcovers. With this business he has an income of close to 22,000 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He also saves some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Moisés has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through his neighbor who had already requested a loan from this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 13,000 meticais to buy blankets, duvet covers and sheets to expand his inventory. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to add on to his house and build a nicer shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets, duvet covers and sheets

loans.name: Opal Amparo

texts.es:
la joven Opal Amparo Salazar tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres en la casa de un tio. 
Opal se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, tambien vende zapatos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, en los ratos que ella no esta en su negocio lo atiende su mama, ya que Opal tambien estudia en la universidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de dos fardos de ropa.
nos comento que se encuentra muy feliz ya que le estan saliendo bien ls cosas con su negocio y que desea ampliarlo en un futuro.
mas su sueño en lo personal es tener su titulo como doctora en medicina.
texts.en:
Opal Amparo Salazar is a 24 year old young woman. She is single, and she lives with her parents in her uncle’s house. Opal sells clothes for women and men. She also sells shoes. She has been doing this for five years. During the times she is not at her business her mother tends to it. Opal also attends the university. She will use the loan to buy bundles of clothes. She says that she is very happy because things are going well for her in her business. She wishes to expand it in the future. Her personal dream is to have her degree as a doctor of medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Sroeun Hang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
These fourteen members are villagers in Tuol Sang Ka village in Takeo province and they make up this village bank loan. Mrs. SrO. H. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses in the current year.

Mrs. SrO. H., 40 years old, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Heng Sor, is a fisherman.

Mrs. SrO. H. has a problem because it is time to plow her field but she does not have the money to do so. So, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to do farming.

Mrs. SrO. H. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a laborer, and the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Mrs. Rachael C. is a 45-year-old mother. She is a wife to Mr. Luke Ifedha. Rachael resides in Bamburi, where her business for tailoring and lessos is located. She plans to purchase more lesso materials (traditional East African cotton print fabric) with the second loan she is requesting. She will use the anticipated profit to purchase an overlock machine to make her tailoring work to be of high quality. In the future, Rachael hopes to be a successful dressmaker and to be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase more lesso materials with her second loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cotton material and ink at wholesale.

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
H. Chu Thị is a 33-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling flowers in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.392.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 9.632.000 VND that will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Chu Thị (20201030020) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hoa trong cộng đồng địa pH..  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị & dụng cụ mới để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara V. S., tiene la edad de 53 años, es soltera y vive sola en su casa, no tiene hijos. Ella quiere  quiere comprar dos Cerdas de cría para que, cuando nazcan los cerditos de mes y medio de edad ,poderlos vender  y tener más ingresos económicos . Además tiene cerca de su casa una pequeña porqueriza  que desea darle utilidad en los ratos libres. En la actualidad trabaja en el comedor escolar de la comunidad,  El Socorro, pero  desea aumentar sus ingresos con la finalidad de ir haciendo un ahorro, pensando en su vejes y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella forma parte del comité de crédito de El Socorro  en el cual es Vocal. Es el tercer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR lo que le ha permitido crecer en lo económico, no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Sara V. S. is 53 years old, single and lives alone in her home. She has no children. She wants to purchase pigs so that when their young are one and a half months old, she can sell them and have more income. Near her home, she also has a small pigpen that she wants to use in her free time. At the moment, she works in her community's (El Socorro) school cafeteria. She wants to increase her income in order to start a savings account, since she is thinking about her old age and also, in order to improve her quality of life. She is a member of El Socorro's credit committee. This is the third loan she has received from FUDECOSUR which has allowed her to prosper economically. She hasn't had other loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR offered a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta D. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture, a general store business. Her husband Gregorio D., who is 55 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have six children who are between 15 and 33 years old. 

Vicenta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vicenta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future for student allowance and for family needs. 

Vicenta D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es:
El señora María cliente antigua trabaja con nosotros hace 10 ciclos de edad de 38 años vive en la zona del torno barrio 6 de Mayo  hace 25 años que vive en esa zona, oriunda de Santa Cruz el torno, su  Estado civil concubina con el sr. Walter de edad 36 años cuenta con la actividad de servicio de transporte hace  5 años de Santa Cruz al Torno, los señores cuentan con dos hijos a su cargo.                                                                                           Su Actividad  comerciante venta de picadito de verduras  es un alimento que comen a media mañana,  vende en a zona mercado del Torno.
La cliente esta agradecida porque nuevamente confiamos en ella  y agilizamos su prestamos para poder invertir en lo que ella  necesita que es  hacer la reserva de queso como la compra de insumos para elaborar su platillo como ya se acerca todos santos día de los difuntos en Bolivia.
texts.en:
María is a former borrower and has worked with Emprender for 10 loan cycles. She is 38 years old and lives in the El Torno area in the 6 de Mayo neighborhood. She has lived in this area for 25 years and is a native of El Torno, located in the department of Santa Cruz. Her live-in partner Walter, who is 36 years old, has had a transportation service for 5 years in El Torno, Santa Cruz. The couple has two children for whom they care. María works selling ‘picadito de verduras’, a dish with vegetables eaten in mid-morning, in the market area of El Torno.

María is grateful that once again we trust her and have facilitated her loans to be able to invest in the things that she needs – stocks of cheese and buying supplies to make her dish, as All Saints Day and Day of the Dead are getting closer in Bolivia.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and ingredients for making her dishes.

loans.name: Llena De Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LLENA DE AMOR, porque ellas se sienten así. Está ubicado en la colonia Lazaro Cardenas, en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la 1era vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. Isabel C. García es integrante del grupo. Tiene 38 años, estudió una carrera técnica, es Estilista y tiene en total 3 hijos varones.  Ella es estilista que inició hace 7 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en artículos para la estética, tinte etc... Sus clientes son variables ya que se encuentra en una calle transitada. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente feliz ya que está iniciando un crédito nuevo con nosotros.   Quiere este crédito para poder invertir en moviliario y mercancía ya que es un poco caro todo su material que requiere. También espera poder crecer como persona.
texts.en: This group is called “Llena de Amor” (Full of Love) because that is how its members feel.  It is located in Lazaro Cadenas district in the State of Mexico.  The group has 10 members and this is the 1st time that they have requested a loan from CrediComún.  Isabel C. García is one of the group's members.  She is 38 years old and studied a technical course.  She is a stylist.  She has 3 sons.  She started working as a stylist 7 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to invest in beauty products, dyes, etc.  Her customers vary since her business is located in a very busy street.  At this moment, requesting her loan, she is feeling happy to be beginning a new loan with us.  She would like this loan so that she can invest in fittings and supplies since the materials which she requires are quite expensive.  She also hopes to be able to grow as a person.

loans.use: To invest in beauty products

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki A. A. is a 33 year old lady who is married to Yusuf Karama. Riziki sells ladies accessories and cold drinks, and this has been her business for the last six years with success.

This is her second loan with KADET and she plans to buy more ladies' accessories (bangles, rings, earrings, etc.) in preparation for the festival and holiday season. She will use the future anticipated profits to boost her cold drink business.

Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' accessories for her business

loans.name: Okumu Taka

texts.en:
Okumu R. Taka is a modest Kenyan enterpreneur from the county of Vihiga , Western Kenya. She is married to Samuel Lwegado, a 38 year-old insurance agent. They have three children aged 10, seven and one years old and they live in the Manugi suburb of Vihiga.

It is now nine years since R. established a retail shop business. She has experienced some good success since she is able to make a monthly income of Kshs. 14,500. R. is a long time client of Kiva partner Kadet Limited and she is taking her eighth loan.  She will use it to buy household items to sell in her retail shop. She will use some of the profits to repay the loan and the rest to pay school fees for her children.

Her wish is to establish a big supermarket where she will be able to stock a variety of items for her customers.

loans.use: To buy household goods for her store.

loans.name: Javkhlantugs

texts.en:
Javkhlantugs is 32 years old. He lives with his mother and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live together in a wooden house that his mother owns. His mother is a retired. 

Javkhlantugs has operated taxi service in city since 2005. Javkhlantugs’s wife is studying in Korea. At the moment, he is responsible for everything for his only daughter, Anu, age 5, who attends a local kindergarten. He is a very hard-working man with a strong will. In the future, he is planning to expand his business and to give his daughter a good education and morals. 

He is requesting a 800.000 MNT loan to purchase a second-hand car in better condition than his current one.

loans.use: To purchase a used car for his taxi business

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg J. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent (called a ger) in the Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her three children all attend school and her husband operates a glass trading business to supplement his family's income.

Altantsatseg currently operates a clothing retail business out of a stall at the Uguuj trade center. She started her business in 2005 and has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. For the future, she hopes to expand her business further. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items to sell for the upcoming New Year's holiday.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing items to sell

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak S. is a 29-year-old married woman blessed with one small child. From Kompong Thom Province, Chak S. weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave the baskets. 

This is a rice harvesting season, and it is a good time for earning additional income. So Chak S. is concerned that she needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store while prices are low. She will sell them when prices are high.

loans.use: To stock up rice while prices are low for future sales

loans.name: Hilda Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Hilda es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, la gente en esta parroquia se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales, son personas carismáticas y muy amables.

La Señora. Hilda tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita. Su esposo es de profesión electricista y con su trabajo y el de su esposo han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Hilda se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y cría pollos, cerdos, cuyes y ganado a los que vende en la feria de la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y fue invitada por sus amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y también para realizar otra chanchera. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in the community of  San Miguel, which belongs to the El Valle parish. People in this parish work as merchants, in agriculture and in raising animals. They are charismatic and kind people.  

Hilda is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children, aged 17 and 11. Her oldest daughter goes to high school and her youngest son is in elementary school.  Her husband is an electricist and with her husband's job, they have been able to build their own home. 

Hilda takes care of the home and raises chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and cattle, which she sells at the city market. 

The is her third loan she has taken out with the communal bank. She was asked to join by her friends. She will invest the loan in purchasing pigs and also making a new pigsty. Her goal is to grow the business of raising animals more.

loans.use: To buy pigs and build a pigsty

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a fifty-two-year-old married man with seven children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He worked in a supermarket for three years and with his savings from his salary, he  was able to start a retail shop. His hardship is having too little capital plus price changes and his vision is owning a supermarket plus educating his children.

Daniel needs the money to buy cartons of mineral water and sugar for sale.

loans.use: Purchasing  water and sugar for sale

loans.name: Alice  Kemunto

texts.en:
Alice Kemunto M., aged 42 years, is married to Charles M.. She has been operating her business for four years and earns an income of thirty thousand shillings per month.

Alice joined KADET LTD because of KADET  marketing events. She is servicing her third loan and will use it to purchase different types of cereals to increase her stock.She repaid the previous loans well and in good time

She  will use the anticipated profits to open another cereals shop. She hopes to have a big cereal shop in the future. Alice describes herself as active and hard-working.

loans.use: to increase stock of cereals in her shop

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Mrs. Ray E. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Phat Sam, have been married since 1985 and have four children- three sons and one daughter. One has full-time employment, two assist their parents in farming and another one is in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ray E. and her husband are farmers. The couple has previously requested a Kiva loan. Ray is now asking for her second loan of 1,000 USD to pay for planting fees and to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to maintain her farm. They hope to continue doing farming because it is their main business.

loans.use: to pay for planting fees and to purchase fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to maintain her farm

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO LABORA COMO AYUDANTE DE PERFORACION DE POZOS, ES CASADO, TIENE TRES HIJOS A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, LOS NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA EN CONSTRUIR UN GARAJE, EN COMPRA DE ARENA, BLOQUE, CEMENTO, HIERRO, ESTRIBO, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRINDA.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco works as a well-drilling assistant and is married with three children under his care.  This is his first loan through CEPRODEL.  He needs it to invest in home improvement, building a garage, and to buy sand, bricks, cement, iron, and buttress materials as well as pay for labor costs.

He is grateful to the institution for this support.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for home improvement

loans.name: Luisa Isaias

texts.pt:
Luisa Isaias N. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casada. Fez somente 3ª classe nao continuou porque os pais nao a deixaram continuar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Maputo para o Distrito de Boane quando se casou, tem um negocio proprio que desenvolve ha mais de 26 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de  3.000.00mt  e conta com ajuda do marido que tem a pensao da companhia Industrial este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte mensalmente em sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversa com suas amigas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo alimentar, arroz, sabao, feijao e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de  7.000.00 e 10.000.00 e ambos foram aplicados para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial para deixar de ser vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
Luisa Isaias N. was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She is married.  She only completed school through the 3rd grade because her parents did not allow her to continue.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports 2 nephews who live with her.  

She left Maputo for Boane when she got married.  She has had her own business for more than 26 years.  She does not have any employees and earns about 3.000.00mt per month.  She has help from her husband who receives a pension from an industrial company.  The money covers household expenses and she saves some monthly in her bank account. 

She has never had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through a conversation with friends who are also clients of the organization.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt.  She will use the loan to purchase products (cooking oil, rice, soap, beans, etc.) to increase her inventory.  Her prior loans were for 7.000.00 and 10.000.00, both of which were used for her business.  

She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to other loans in the future.  She plans to request new loans to build a shop and no longer sell her products in the streets.

loans.use: to purchase products (cooking oil, rice, soap, beans, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María es soltera de 37 años de edad, vive en casa de unos familiares ubicada en laparte urbana, contando con los servicios de agua y luz del distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz, el caul pertenece al distrito de Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza por ser una zona muy comercial al por mayor ymenor.

María se dedica  a la venta de verduras,  frutas y otros alimentos en una carretilla  desde hace 10 años, lo realiza  por las calles del distrito en donde vive. Los productos que ofrece estan enmuy buen estado (maduros y limpios) por eso las personas de esta zona le compran por la confianza  que brinda sus productos y es una manera de cubrir sus  necesidades diarias. Otra foma como también se ayuda económicamente es realizando limpieza en casa de algunas personas que la conocen.

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa fue de 2500 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizará  para comprar mas frutas, verduras y otros alimentos para que ofresca  a sus clientes y así mas adelante tener mayores ingresos y poder solventar sus gastos y ayudar a sus  familiares en lo que es necesario.

María es una mujer con muchos ideales y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más adelante un puesto en el mercado, sin dejar de ayudar para mejorar a sus familiares con los que vive.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and single.  She lives with her family in a house located in the urban part of Jose Leonardo Ortiz.  It has electricity and running water.  This is part of the Chiclayo district, a commercial district which includes large and small businesses.

María sells fruits and vegetables and other food from her cart and has been doing so in her district for the past 10 years.  Her products are good quality (ripe and clean) and people buy from her with confidence.  In this way she is able to cover her daily expenses.  She also earns money by cleaning the homes of people who know her.

She will use the money from this loan of 2,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more fruit, vegetables, and other things she sells to her customers.  In this way she will be able to increase her income, pay her expenses, and help her family with their needs in the future.

María is a woman with lots of ideals and one of them is to have her own stall in the market by means of her work and effort and without discontinuing assistance to her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Nob resides in Siem Reap Province and earns daily revenue by selling ice next to her house. She has a life partner in her husband. He is an ice porter for a general store, and he could get a fixed salary of approximately 2 USD a day for his work. Nob is concerned, because her husband always rents a motor taxi to go to work. In order to reduce this expense, Nob would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a used motorbike for her husband to drive to his job location. Nob has two children who are attending local school and who still rely on her income.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for her husband to drive to his job location.

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.en:
Euphrasie is a 53-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who sells foodstuffs.  She has been running her business for 14 years and has used the profits generated from it to provide education and food for her children.

Euphrasie is widowed and has 4 children between the ages of 22 and 31.  The eldest is married and the others are still in school.

She will use this loan to purchase green bananas, Irish potatoes, and beans that she will sell at her business.  She will use the profits from her business to accumulate savings that she will use to feed her children and provide capital for her eldest.

She runs her business with the ambition of one day becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy green bananas, Irish potatoes and beans to resell

loans.name: Sinorn

texts.en:
Sinorn, 31 years old, is a grocery seller and also has a small coffee shop at home. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income per day is $8. They have two children, 7 years old and 1 month old. 

Every month, she has to spend $46 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $5 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy more things to sell in the grocery store. Before, she sold vegetables in the market, but the price of renting a store there was so expensive that she could not make profit from it, so she decided to stop and start selling groceries at home with her small savings. Now her career is better than before. She has more things to sell but still not enough for her customers, so she would like to buy some more for her customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy things to sell in her grocery shop.

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Sanu is 50 years old.  She is married and has four children aged 26, 22, 20 and 18.  In 1998, she established  her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Sanu plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nicel

texts.en:
Nicel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Nicel has a retail shop that sells breads, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Nicel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nicel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Katiba

texts.en: Katiba is a married man with five children, four of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. For the past ten years, he has operated a carpentry business; his potential customers are neighbours and restaurant operators. His greatest challenge is the delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of expanding his business to improve his lifestyle. With the Kshs 10,000 Katiba wants to purchase timber and carpentry tools. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills, school fees and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a second-hand clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her challenge in the business is seasonality. During the rainy season, the demand for heavy clothing increases while the demand for light clothing decreases. She dreams of becoming the leading supplier of second-hand clothes in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria H

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manhiça, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais todos frequentam a escola. Fez o nivel superior e parou por falta de tempo. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu da sua terra natal para Maputo em missão de serrviço, é professora ha mais de 16 anos na escola primaria completa de salinas, e tem um salário de 13.133.29mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já fez emprestimo no BIM no valor de 30.000.00mt para dar inicio a sua obra,o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma colega que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de constrção DE UMA CASA (areia, barrotes, cimento, ferro, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.300.00mt, e 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt.
Pretende concluir a sua casa,mobiliar para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Manhiça, in the southern Mocambican province of Maputo. She is a single mother of 3 children who all go to school. Maria started higher level studies but left without completing them due to other time pressures. She lives in her own home with her family and she does not support anyone else.
She left her home town and came to Maputo in search of work. She has been a teacher for 16 years at the salt works' full primary school; she earns a monthly salary of 13,133.29MTs which covers her household expenses and leaves a little for her to save in her Millennium BIM bank account. 
She has previously borrowed 30,000MTs from the Millennium BIM bank to start her project. She repaid this with ease. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This is her third loan with this institution, for 20,000MTs, which Maria will use to buy building materials for her house (sand, beams, cement, iron, stone and other materials) in order to carry on with the work. Her previous loans were for 8,300MTs, 10,000MTs and 15,000MTs.
Maria wants to finish building her house and furnish it so that her family will be comfortable. She intends to apply for further Hluvuku loans for this purpose.

loans.use: to build a house (to purchase sand, beams, cement, iron, stone and other materials).

loans.name: Irma Giorgina

texts.es:
Giorgina nació en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 54 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos (damas, caballeros y niños), ella no tiene un puesto de venta pero ofrece sus productos mediante catálogos, ella también se dedica a la venta de productos de la maraca Natura.   

Giorgina requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo zapatos y ropa. El sueño de Giorgina es abrir una ferretería. 

El Banco Comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco,  Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Giorgina was born in the city of Urubamba, in Cusco province (Peru). She is 54, married, with three children. She lives in the city of Cusco, where she carries on her business. She sells clothing and shoes (women's, men's, children's). She doesn't have a fixed sales location, but instead sells her products through catalogues. She also sells products from the Nature brand. 

Giorgina needs the loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes and clothing. Giorgina's dream is to open a hardware store.

The members of the "Nueva Vision Urubamba" communal bank meet every thirty days in the city of Urubamba (Cusco province, Peru).  Cusco is known as a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, "Machu Piccchu" is located there.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: La señora Simona, es comerciante de ají y viaja por todo el pais dos veces al mes comprando y vendiendo el producto; su esposo es chofer y también tiene un equipo de amplificación con el cual presta servicios de DJ en acontecimientos sociales. El crédito lo solicita para incrementar el capital de  trabajo y comprar mayor cantidad de ají, pues es un producto que ella comercializa exitosamente. Simona vive en casa alquiler ubicado en la zona de Villa Esperanza en  la ciudad de El Alto;  es casada y tiene tres hijos. Simona tiene una relación con IMPRO desde el año 2006 y los créditos le han ayudado muchisimo en mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. Esta es la segunda vez que su préstamo es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Simona is a chili pepper merchant.  She travels throughout the country twice a month buying and selling this product.  Her husband is a driver and also has a sound system that he uses to provide DJ services at social events.  She’s asking for the loan to increase capital to buy a larger amount of chili pepper because it’s a product that she sells quite successfully.  

Simona lives in a rented house located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Esperanza zone.  She’s married and has three children.  Simona has had a relationship with IMPRO since 2006 and the loans have helped her immensely to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  This is the second time her loan is channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy chili pepper at wholesale.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth is 31 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two school-aged children. 

Jeaneth has engaged in a motorcycle transport business to make a living. She owns the vehicle and it is operated personally by her husband so as to fully receive the income in each day of work. Everyday needs of the household are primarily taken from this income. She has had this business for two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 10,000 to purchase motor tires and spare parts.

Jeaneth is a new member of the cooperative, having initially borrowed the above mentioned amount. Jeaneth hopes to resume the business operations immediately to cover the day-to-day needs of the family. She plans to widen the seating capacity to accommodate more passengers, and to save some portion of her income in preparation for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase motor tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Maria Olma

texts.es: María Olma tiene 33 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Inicio hace 7 años, ella empieza su labor desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche pues algunos clientes llegan a conversar con María pues es una persona alegre y muy tranquila. Ella tiene muchas objetivos con este crédito pues la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de productos y esto le reconforta es por eso que solicita este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, papel higiénico, sopas, enlatados, fósforos, cigarrillos, pan, gaseosas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
María Olma is 33 years old and has a convenience store that she opened seven years ago.  She works from 7 in the morning until 9 in the evening, since some customers come to chat with her because she is a happy and very peaceful person.

María has many goals for her loan, since the majority of her customers ask her for a wide variety of products, which comforts her.  This is why she is requesting this loan to buy bulk grains, toilet paper, soup, canned goods, matches, cigarettes, bread, soda, and other products.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, toilet paper, soup, canned goods, matches, cigarettes, bread, soda, and other products.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 12 children, Cynthia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from wholeselling/retailing crablets. 

Cynthia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Cynthia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Martha vive al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 22 años.  Ella propietaria de una tienda en el barrio La Pradera, desde hace un poco más de 3 años. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la vivienda de  sus padres;  posee toda la infraestructura necesaria para buen funcionamiento de este tipo de actividad y en este  sector  maneja una baja la competencia;  tiene un muy buen nivel de ventas y un surtido con variedad y calidad. Sus inventarios adecuados, y su cartera o cuentas por cobrar las maneja con mucha precaución. El margen de rentabilidad de su negocio, le permite tener una buena capacidad de pago, las rotaciones tanto de cartera como de inventarios son agiles. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva con el cual surtirá la microempresa  con productos para la temporada de fin de año, pues planea provisionarse para afrontar los aumentos de los precios que normalmente son en el mes de Enero.  Su sueño es lograr una educación de calidad para sus hijos esperando que ellos sean profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Martha lives in the southwest part of the city with her partner and her four children, ages 13 to 22.  She has owned a store in the La Pradera neighborhood for a little more than three years. 

Her business is located in her parent's house. She has all the infrastructure necessary for operating this kind of business well; and competition in this part of the city is declining.  She has a very good sales volume and a varied, high quality selection.  She has adequate inventories, and manages her accounts payable cautiously. The profit margin of her business allows her to have a good ability to pay. Turnover of both accounts payable and inventory is rapid.

Currently she is applying for her first Credikiva loan, in order to stock her convenience store with products for the end of year season. She plans to stock up in order to cope with the price increases that generally occur in the month of January. Her dream is to provide a quality education to her children, hoping that they will become successful professionals.

loans.use: To supply her convenience store with products for the end of year season.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha has been running a curio shop to earn a living.  Previously, she requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy necklaces and African design fabric.  With the additional stock she made good sales.  Her desire is to grow her business and get enough capital to build rental houses.  She has requested 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy necklaces and soapstone carvings.

loans.use: to buy necklaces and soapstone carvings.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Virgilio is 36 years-old. He is married and has two children. They live in Saranay where he manages their corn field. He had been in his farm for ten years. Due to an unexpected typhoon, he received only P12,000 from his last crop. His wife also does hog-raising business for additional family income. They are both thankful because the income they generate from their businesses helps them to provide their daily needs and to be able to continue sending their children to school. Now, Virgilio is requesting a loan of P40,000 in order to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested and he is promising to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. Teresa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, Conocer  Cuenca es conocer la historia de un país, es viajar maravillosamente al pasado desde el presente, por la belleza de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradiciones que la caracterizan, cuenta con una variada  gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

La Señora. Teresa tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y uno de sus hijos estudia en una universidad de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Teresa es comerciante de ropa, no tiene un puesto fijo por lo que vende ambulantemente, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de blusas, pantalones, camisetas y ropa de niños para tener una mayor variedad en sus productos.
 
Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos para traer mercadería.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the “El Crédito” communal bank.  She lives near downtown Cuenca.  To know Cuenca is to know the history of a country.  It is to travel from the present to the past for the beauty of its historic city center, its characteristic culture and traditions; it has a varied cuisine that enchants locals and foreigners alike.

Teresa is 49 years old, married and has three children who are all adults now.  Two of her children are employed and help out economically and one of them attends one of the universities in the city.  The house she lives in is her property.

Teresa is a clothing merchant.  She does not have a fixed stand; she sells door to door and works Monday through Friday with no fixed work schedule.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for five years and will use the new loan to buy blouses, pants, shirts and children’s clothes to have more variety in stock.  Her dream is to travel to the United States to bring merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Malinga

texts.en:
Malinga is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. Three of them are in school. She has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for one year.

Malinga is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, cooking oil, and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, cooking oil, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 44 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been running a green grocery business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,500.

Beatrice is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Beatrice will use the loan to buy stock of green vegetables and fruits to add to her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. 

Her hope and dream is to open a retail shop, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of green vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is a twenty-two-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent house.

He has been dealing in the coffee trade for one year and his major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a goal of moving his business to a more permanent location and owning a coffee store that can supply the whole district.The purpose of the loan is to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee for resale

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián es un joven emprendedor que decidió montar su propio negocio con el ánimo de poder pagar sus propios estudios universitarios. Con 26 años de edad, Sebastián administra su negocio donde ofrece a sus clientes gran variedad de tenis, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para pagarse sus estudios y aportar económicamente en su hogar. Sebastián tiene su negocio hace aproximadamente 2 años, y la desventaja más grande que tiene es que debido al poco capital con el que cuenta su negocio tiene muy poco surtido de mercancía, por lo que no puede atender todas las necesidades de sus clientes. Con el ánimo de aumentar su inventario, Sebastián busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de tenis para aumentar su inventario y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.

Sebastián espera que de esta manera tenga mayores ventas, pues podrá satisfacer necesidades de sus clientes que antes no podía satisfacer por el bajo nivel de inventarios. Además, Sebastián tiene el sueño de que su negocio crezca y se pueda ubicar en un local más grande donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.

loans.use: Compra de tenis para aumentar su inventario y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.

loans.name: Myriam De Jesus

texts.es:
Myriam es madre soltera cabeza de hogar de 4 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida. Por esto, desde hace 20 años que se separó de su esposo y se vio en la obligación de generar ingresos con los cuales pudiera sacar adelante a sus hijos, empezó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catálogos. Con su negocio logró sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y el acceso a una buena educación, y ahora es su fuente de ingresos para seguir sosteniendo gran parte de los gastos de su hogar. Gracias a la experiencia que tiene en la actividad ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, quienes le hacen grandes pedidos de sus productos; por esto, Myriam busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y poder responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá seguir con su negocio superando la dificultad de no contar con un suficiente capital, además de que seguirá generando ingresos para sostener los gastos de su hogar y así tener en su familia una buena calidad de vida.

loans.use: Comprar productos de uso personal y poder responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.name: Rusvel

texts.es:
Rusvel tiene 30 años, vive en la cálida ciudad de Aguaytia, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido, asimismo por el desarrollo de la agricultura y el turismo, Rusvel es padre de 2 pequeños y al lado de su esposa lucha cada día para poder brindarle a su familia una vida digna y sobre todo brindarle a sus hijos mucho amor y comprensión. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Rusvel solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma.

Cada día Rusvel se levanta muy temprano para poder ir a trabajar a su campo de cultivo, ya que el es agricultor y actualmente ha sembrado plátano, el le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 5 horas al día y el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y porque le gusta lo que hace.

Rusvel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otro; con lo cual podrá mejorar su cultivo y obtener una mejor cosecha, lo que le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y ser propietarios de una parcela agrícola”.
texts.en:
Zonia is a 53-year-old woman. Her house is located in the city of Pisco, where there are beautiful beaches, and where the main industry is agriculture, especially cotton, beans, and lima beans. Since she was young, Zonia has had to work because her parents did not have much income and therefore she only finished middle school, although she would have loved to study to become a fashion designer. 

Zonia is the mother of three children whom she loves very much, and she works very hard to provide for them and to give them the opportunities that she did not have.

Every day, Zonia works in her small tailoring and repairs business. She works for around 10 hours a day and serves around 20 customers a day. She believes that she is moving forward with her business because she is very kind to the customers and, above all, because she does a good job. 

Zonia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their great help she will be able to buy supplies for her business like silk, zippers, tubes, thread, elastic among other items, and in this way she will have the necessary materials to increase her income. She will continue working hard day in day out to achieve her dream which is to own her own premises and to be able to give her children a good education.

loans.use: Para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, enter otros.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is twenty eight years old , with two children, and lives in Beit Safafa in south Jerusalem. Ameera holds a master's degree in Education from Bir Zeit University, and a Batchelor’s in Science from Beit Lehem University. After looking for work for a long time, Ameera has in the last year established a kindergarten in Sur Baher, in the east of the city, working with her sister. They have both received business training from MATI, a business development foundation in Jerusalem. After receiving all the required approvals for the kindergarten (which is unusual in the east of the city, but ensures a safe and supportive environment for the children), they began the school year with 37 children. They reached an agreement with the Municipality in which the Municipality would subsidize the tuition of each child so that the parents would only pay NIS 1,500 (US$400) for the entire year. She employs 2 teachers and 2 teaching assistants, and according to the work plan next year there will be over 50 children in the kindergarten.

Ameera is seeking a loan to purchase equipment to enhance the nursery: play equipment, cooking equipment to allow her to provide cooked meals, audiovisual aids, etc.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to enhance the nursery

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is a young, aged 27, single, with a child. She lives in an urban area. She has been in this business for the past four years which makes her very experienced, stable, and profitable. This is her first loan with us. She also runs a small provision store. She realized a turnover of more than 3,000,000 FCFA per month. This loan will increase her capital by 200 000 Fcfa and her turnover by 6 percent and her output by 9 percent, hence her standard of living will increase as well.

loans.use: to pay for communication credit

loans.name: Grupo La Cuchilla Agricola Group

texts.es:
Gerardo es un hombre de 33 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 5 y 12 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Gerardo con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica al cultivo de maíz, con esta actividad lleva  10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Gerardo por ser el cultivo su mayor fuente de ingresos le preocupa mucho no contar con el capital suficiente para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz por esa razón acude a un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy two steers

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika has many years of experience in trade. At the beginning, she was helping her father and later separated her own business. She was very successful in her business. She is sure that her success is in variety of goods that she sells.

Mastchoh is small town with a small number of customers, so selling only one type of goods is not very profitable. When she started working in the market she used to sell only female clothes, then added men’s and kids' clothes. She brings her goods from Khujand and Istaravshan weekly. Over time she added clocks, perfume and gifts in her assortment. With her last loan she also added various toys.

loans.use: Adding assortment of toys

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino is employed as a carpenter and doesn't have his own shop. He and his wife, who does not work, have three children. They live in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz. This is the first loan he has requested. He will use the funds to buy a set of hand tools so that he can set up his own shop fixing furniture and increase his income. His experience in carpentry and the salary he receives give him access to this loan. He is very eager to begin working for himself.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rufino es carpintero asalariado y no cuenta con un taller propio. Su esposa no trabaja, y tiene un hijo de 3 años. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con nuestra Institución. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de herramientas manuales de carpintería para poder incrementar sus ingresos y realizar arreglos de muebles en general y poder trabajar por cuenta propia Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el ramo de la carpintería. El salario que percibe le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo, y su inquietud de querer empezar a trabajar por cuenta propia es un punto clave para la aprobación de este crédito.

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools.

loans.name: Mitroayebou

texts.fr:
Mr. Mitroayébou S. is a well-known farmer in the village of Tannou. Born in 1947, he started working in the fields at a very young age. He is married and a father of twenty five (25) children whom he supports thanks to the earnings from his agricultural activites. Nowadays, his cultivated fields are becoming exhausted and do not produce as much as they used to. This is worrying, especially since the land is his only source of income. He is asking for a loan of $1200 in order to buy fertilizer in order to revive the yield of his fields. This will enable him to provide sufficient income for his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Mitroayébou est un agriculteur très reconnu dans le village de tannou. Né en 1947, il a débuté ses travaux de culture de la terre dès le bas âge. Il est aujourd’hui marié et père de vingt cinq (25) enfants qu’il supporte grâce aux revenus tirés de son agriculture. De nos jours, les terres cultivées sont épuisées et n’arrivent plus à produire comme cela se doit. C’est un fait inquiétant quand on sait que c’est sa seule source de revenu. Il sollicite ainsi un crédit de $1200 pour acheter du fertilisant afin de raviver la capacité de production des terres qu’il cultive. Cela lui permettra de subvenir valablement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer for land

loans.name: Adila

texts.en: Adila, 49 is a widow with one child. She lives in Khachmaz town and has a business selling shoes to retail stores/shops. Adila has three years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of $725 to buy more inventory for ressale.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry maize

loans.name: Taaloga

texts.en: Taaloga is a 35-year-old married woman. She is from Levili Village, and is currently a member of Levili Toefuataina centre. Her business is elei (a traditional Samoan fabric). The printing is done by her and her husband at her own house. She sells 10-15 lavalava at $8 USD each to the people of her village and delivered to the nearby shops in town.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her elei printing business

loans.name: Paulina Marina's Group

texts.en:
Augustina and Marina have been members of the community bank “Kusikuy” for 13 years. Martina has been a member for 8. In that time they have learned about responsibility, punctuality, and a good work ethic. In addition they have learned about self-esteem, educating their children, and getting along with their neighbors. Within their bank they feel united and able to support each other, this is what they say is lacking in other banks.

Augustina is 38. She is single and doesn’t have children of her own, but has been raising her nieces and nephews. She sells emoliente, which is a traditional beverage made from herbs and served warm. She has been doing this for 22 years.

Martina is 39 and has three children. She has been selling grains for the past six years from a stand in the central market of Ayacucho. She sells a variety of grains such as wheat, barley, quinoa, and oats.

Marina is 62 years old and has two adult children. She has been selling food staples such as flour and beans for 10 years. Before that she traveled to the country to buy leather and sell it in Ayacucho, but enjoys having to travel less.

Augustina, Marina, and Martina need loans of 800, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their business by buying things such as sugar, wheat, cornmeal, barley, flour, milk, and oil. They dream of owning their homes and giving their children an education.

loans.use: Augustina, Marina, and Martina need loans of 800, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their business by buying things such as sugar, wheat, cornmeal, barley, flour, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Daima

texts.en: Daima is a hard-working mother of 3, and a resident of Tandika, Dar Es Salaam city suburb. She has been in business for the five years, and runs a shop selling food, ranging from beans, maize, rice, and other items. She is in need of USD $1200 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Etna

texts.es:
Etna P. Arévalo belongs to the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank. She lives in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She sells sweets from the coastal region of the country such as kinkones and manjares. She runs her business from her home, since she distributes the products by order to stores and other commercial outlets.

She decided to start her business based on her own initiative and because she likes to work with people. She also wanted to generate her own income and grow as a person and as a woman.

With a loan of S/. 1000.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy the sweets by the box. She is also thinking of expanding the business by selling other sweets from the mountain regions, such as rosquillas from Cajamarca, cookies, and cakes, so that she can meet the demand from her customers. Etna is 46 years old and has three financially independent children who are responsible and capable of making their own decisions. She is content with the job she does. She has the support of her husband, is very well known, and has a good clientele because of the quality of her products and her friendly sales manner.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Etna P. Arévalo pertenece al B.C. “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de dulces triados de la costa del país como: kinkones, y manjares, desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa, ya que sus productos los reparte por pedidos a las bodegas y otros centros comerciales Decidió iniciar su negocio por su propia iniciativa y por que le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1000.00 a ser pagado en 6 meses comprará estos dulces por cajas. También piensa incrementar este negocio con la venta de otros dulces triados de la sierra del país como: rosquillas cajamarquinas, galletas y tortas y así satisfacer la gran demanda de sus clientes. Tiene 46ños y 3 hijos independientes, responsable y capaz de tomar sus propias decisiones, esta contenta con lo que hace, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, es muy conocida y tiene una buena clientela por la calidad de sus productos y la amabilidad que brinda al vender.

loans.use: To buy sweets for resale

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara S. is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children, aged 3 to 14 years old. Sara sells vegetables, maize and milk. She started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7.30 am to 4 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables and maize for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and maize for her business.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đỗ Thị Nghĩa is 55 years old. She lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa with her family. They were very poor before joining TYM fund. At first, she contracted a very small loan to make it easy on the payment. After a year, things went well for her: it was easy to make the weekly payment and her family income has increased. So Mrs Nghĩa started to take out bigger loans. After 3 years, she has been able to buy all the basic goods for her household and also a motorcycle. Her family income from the fishing business is 100-130 USD a month. She also exploits her rice paddle and raises livestock to increase her income. This time she is seeking 375 USD to buy fishing net and tools.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Nghĩa, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và các con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Khi mới tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị rất nghèo, vòng vốn đầu chị chỉ xin vay mức vốn thấp để tiện hoàn trả. Sau một năm, cảm thấy việc hoàn trả tuần thuận tiện cho mình và gia đình cộng với việc kinh tế phát triển hơn trước, chị Nghĩa đã mạnh dạn vay các mức vốn cao hơn. Sau hơn 3 năm tham gia Quỹ, chị Nghĩa đã sắm thêm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình và một chiếc xe máy mới. Thu nhập hàng tháng từ việc đánh bắt cá từ 100-130USD. Ngoài ra chị Nghĩa còn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi để tăng thêm thu nhập. Vòng vốn này chị Nghĩa đề nghị xin vay 375USD để mua lưới và dụng cụ đánh bắt mới.

loans.use: Buy fishing net and tools

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Bakti

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Bakti works in her parents' field. However the production is not enough to fulfill her family's daily needs. Her husband works as a furniture maker. However he has not been making much money due to the downturn in business. This motivated Nyoman to start a pig farm with DINARI's help. This loan was used ti purchase a piglet and feeds. With DINARI's financial and technical help, Nyoman earned $260 after 6 months breeding to slaughter cycle. With this result, Nyoman Bakti decided to seek second loan from DINARI. This second loan will be used to purchase more piglets and feeds than before. Nyoman hopes to reap more profit and help her family's finances more.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Bertani di kebun orang tuanya merupakan kesehari-harian Ni Nyoman Bakti. Tetapi dari hasil kebun tersebut tidak mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya. Suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai tukang meubel juga tidak terlalu banyak membantu penghasilan keluarga karena sepinya order dan sulitnya mencari bahan baku meubel. Selanjutnya Nyoman berusaha beternak babi dengan meminjam ke DINARI. Pinjaman tersebut kemudian dibelikan bibit babi dan pakannya untuk digemukkan. Dengan pendampingan dari DINARI, Nyoman berhasil memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp. 2.400.000,- selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan.
