Dengan hasil yang terlihat memuaskan tersebut, Nyoman Bakti memutuskan untuk kembali bekerja sama dengan DINARI untuk mendapatkan pinjaman kedua. Dari pinjaman kedua ini nantinya akan dibelikan bibit dan pakan babi yang lebih banyak dari pembelian dengan pinjaman pertama. Sehingga Nyoman berharap akan memperoleh keuntungan yang lebih baik lagi sehingga mampu mendongkrak perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Feeds

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga is a humble client of scarse resources who supports her three school-age children. Her husband helps her with his income. She works in a cellular phone store, which is her only job, since she was unable to have other opportunities to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase a calling center, as well as phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel lives in the 3-80 neighborhood of Managua. She runs a convenience store out of her home. She is married, and she also cares for her 78-year-old mother. The loans she is requesting will be used to build a room for her mother, because in to her advanced age she needs comfort and privacy. Maria Isabel has had her business for 12 years, starting out by selling caramels and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Isabel habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, en su casa de habitación tiene una pulpería la cual es atendida por ella misma. Es casada y a su cargo tiene a su madre de 78 años de edad. El préstamo será usado para la construcción de una habitación para su mamá, ya que por su avanzada edad, necesita de comodidad y privacidad. Doña Maria Isabel tiene 12 años de tener su pequeño negocio el cual empezó con ventas de caramelos y refrescos.

loans.use: Build a room for her mother / Construcción de un cuarto para su madre

loans.name: Mary Nambalirwa's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 44-year-old married woman with 4 children, aged between 20 and 5. All of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a 2-room house, where she is staying with 4 of her husband's children. There are 6 people who live there.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Mary works in Owino market, one of the city suburbs, and deals in second-hand clothes. She sells to an average of 10 people a day and works 6 days a week. Mary's monthly expenses include school fees and rent. She has been in this business for 6 years. She used to operate a beauty salon but had to change to second-hand clothes due to the high demand for them and their profitability.

Mary's main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season, which makes storage facilities difficult. She has been with MCDT for 6 years and is servicing her eleventh loan, working all this long time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business. .

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Santa Evangelina would like to purchase women's clothing and beauty products for her clothing store and beauty shop.

loans.name: Siona

texts.en:
Siona is divorced with two children; she lives near Bamenda, Cameroon.  With this loan, Siona plans to invest in her businesses of knitting pullovers, farming, and making homemade yogurt.  She will invest her loan in purchases of thread for knitting, fertilizer for farming, and a deep freezer for her yogurt.  She plans to contribute 40,000 CFA ($80 USD) of her own savings towards her business plan.

This is Siona's second loan with GHAPE.  Her experience in this market has taught her that there is a strong demand for these goods that she plans to provide.  She also has a strong client base already; she hopes to expand her client base with the business skills that GHAPE has taught her.  Her yogurt will provide a source of protein for those in her community.  She plans to pass her knitting skills to other in her community, so that they can also knit and develop another source of income.

The profits from this loan will be used to pay for Siona's children's school fees; this has been somewhat difficult for her after divorcing her husband.  She will also ensure that her family eats well, is clothed well, and can be cared for in times of ill health.  She hopes to use some of her profits to reinvest in her business.  She plans to increase her profits using the skills she has learned in her business and management training from GHAPE.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy thread, fertilizer, and a deep freezer

loans.name: Javanshir

texts.en:
Javanshir M., a married 40-year-old retailer with two sons and both sets of parents living with him, is working hard to achieve a better lifestyle and rise out of poverty. Since 1996, he has been engaged in the sale of spare car parts, offering the parts for a variety of automobiles from a stall he operates in the local market As a result of the success of his business, Javanshir has gradually improved the living conditions of his family and is doing his best to meet all the needs of his dearest sons.

Javanshir now wishes to increase his stock of inventory in order to increase sales volume and so is requesting a loan of $1200 with which he plans to purchase spare parts for cars including Mercedes, Opel, and Volkswagen. With your help this will be possible. Be an important part of the growth of Javanshir’s business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio, es propietario de una despensa él es casado y tiene 2 hijos, su señora es modista y también trabaja en su domicilio, la despensa que poseen esta muy bien surtida y también lo tienen en su mismo domicilio en la ciudad de San José.
 Comenta el señor que con los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo surtir de gran cantidad de productos de rotación rápida, como ser azúcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz entre otros productos de consumo diario, esto genero  más atracción a los clientes potenciales por lo bien surtido que esta su negocio.
Su objetivo a corto plazo y es la comprar materia prima para la elaboración de chipas y venderlo en su despensa, así también desea incorporar la venta de helados y comidas rápidas, ya que en años anteriores en época de verano ya experimento con estos productos y le fue muy bien, entre las comidas a ofertar son hamburguesas, empanadas, pollo, milanesas, etc.
texts.en:
Gregorio owns a grocery store. He is married with 2 children; his wife is a dressmaker and both work out of their home. Their well-stocked grocery is in their home in the city of San José. Gregorio tells us that the loans he has received from Fundación Paraguaya have allowed him to buy high turn-over products in bulk, such as sugar, tea, beef, chicken, oil, noodles, rice among other daily foods which made the store more attractive to potential customers given that it is so well stocked. His short-term goal is to buy the raw materials to make chips to sell in his store; he would also like to begin selling ice cream and fast-foods as he has experimented with these in previous Summers and found that they sold well. He plans to offer food as well, such as hamburgers, empanadas, chicken, milanesas (breaded beef), etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sugar, tea, milk, cookies, a variety of drinks, etc.

loans.name: Longole-Aisha Deya Group

texts.en:
Aisha D. (right) is 45 years old. She is a married mother of 5 children of whom one is working and the rest are still in school. Aisha has been running a restaurant for 3 years now. Her menu comprises of local dishes and delicacies. 

She needs a loan to enable her to stock foods like grains and cereals which have a long shelf life. Her dream is to open up a handcrafts workshop. She hopes that the income from the business enables her to support her husband in educating the children.

This is a group loan, where each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase grains and cereals.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. Since 1985, she has been growing rice and vegetables to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 1.50 every day. Her husband helps support the household by working as recycler. He goes from house to house to purchase recycling items and sell them to the market-recycler to earn approximately US$ 3.50 in profit per day. This couple has 2 young children, both of whom attend school.<>

Mrs. Chum S. would like to take out a loan to make two investments. She will provide $200 to her husband so he can use it to purchase more recycling items, and the rest will be used to buy farmland to expand her cultivation.

loans.use: buying farmland

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
B. Bakhtiyor is a young, married man who breeds calves in Spitamen, a small village of the Sugd region. Bakhtiyor is young but full of energy. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Bakhtiyor started his business five years ago. He continued the business of his father, who is a pensioner. Bakhtiyor has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed it from his childhood.

He would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase income and improve life conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; for the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase more calves

loans.name: Elba Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Elba , es originario de la comarca Las F. perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental ubicado en la capital, ellas compran las cosechas en las comarcas vecinas y sacan el producto al mercado..
Se decidieron trabajar con Adim porque les gusta que les enseñen a manejar un crédito y otras cosas como el control contable de los ingresos de sus negocios y a ser dueñas de sus negocios. Este grupo abona los días Lunes porque se considera que es el mejor día para abonar, esto porque las ventas del fin de semana son las mejores.

Doña Keyla María es una joven mujer de 25 años madre de tres hijo pequeños de 7,5 y 2 años , su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar él trabaja como artesano en un taller de Masaya. Ella vende frutas y verduras, pero además vende pan que es un producto que ofrece a sus clientes y le ha dado resultado, ella expresa que con el crédito ha podido diversificar los productos y así tener mejores ventas. Tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio y ahorrar para eventualidades y así no tocar los ingresos del negocio.
texts.en:
The supportive group Elba is from the area of Las F. in the city of Masaya and in general the members dedicate themselves to the sale of fruits and vegetables in a market situated in the east of the capital. They purchase items harvested in the neighboring region and take them to market. They decided to work with Adim because they are taught how to manage a loan and other things such as financial accounting of their income and how to be owners of their businesses. This group pays on Mondays which they consider the best day to pay because their sales are best during the weekend. Mrs. Keyla María is a young woman of 25 years and a mother of three small children ages 7, 5, and 2. Her husband helps with the household expenses by working as an artisan in a workshop in Masaya. She sells fruits and vegetables, and also sells bread which is a product she offers her customers and which has given results. She tells us that the loans have enabled her to diversify her offerings and thereby have better income. Her goal is to grow her business and save for contingencies and therefore she doesn’t touch the income from her business.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the conditions of her business

loans.name: Marienel

texts.en:
Marienel is married to her very supportive husband, Felvin Daguia. She is 33 years old, an entrepreneur, and a mother of two children: John Rondel - 8 years old, a grade-school student and Christian - 2 years old. Marienel is hoping that they can provide a good and quality education for their children someday. She and her family live in the mountainous village of Mapalad of San Agustin, Isabela.

Marienel manages a general store in their village. Aside from her store, she is also engaged in the direct selling of beauty products. She is thankful that her family helps her in the business, especially in dealing with her customers. With her need of additional business capital, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 for further development of her store. Her business is of great help to her family and to the education of her children and also helps their farming needs. She hopes that she can become a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: Further development of her general store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through Senior High School. Monica sells Milo (cocoa powder), sugar, soap, etc. in Elmina, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a private driver. Monica uses her income to assist her husband in paying fees and bills. Monica will use the loan to purchase more provisions for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: purchase more provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат – 34 лет. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Её муж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Инобат было всего лишь 10 овец. Но год назад она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Сейчас у Инобат две дойной коровы. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат. Инобат очень рада что в трудный момент ее жизни наша организация помогает ей.
texts.en:
Inobat is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband left for Russia to find work. He was not able to find a good job Tajikistan, and was unable to save money to buy them cattle. Inobat has only ten sheep, but a year ago she learned of the MicroInvest loan program, and came to take out a loan to purchase a milk cow. Now Inobat has two milk cows. Until her husband has found work in Russia and sends her money, her brother is helping out. Inobat is pleased that at this difficult time in her life, MicroInvest is assisting her.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Admira

texts.en: Admira P. is 34 and comes from the town of Tuzla. She is married and has two children; her daughter is 7 and her son is 11. Her husband is employed and earns well. Admira sells clothes at the big market in Tuzla. She resells very nice clothes and her clothes offer is really good. Admira has been our client for a long time. She repaid six loans from  WWI (Žene za Žene International). All these loans were invested in the clothes business. She requested her seventh loan in the amount of 2500 KM. Admira has big experience in this business and knows that big and good offers lead to bigger earnings.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Зардов Рахим проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 45 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Рахим более 6 лет занимается животноводством, он покупает крупно рогатый скот откармливает и продает. Ему в этом такде помогают его дети. Клиент просит кредит, для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Rahim Z. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 45 years old, married and has 9 children. Rahim has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. He buys cattle, feeds it and resells it. His children also help him with the business. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Zulmat

texts.en:
A. Zulmat is 51 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. In order to help the husband to support the large family, Zulmat started her own business. So for the last 13 years Zulmat has been selling curtains. She has her own trading place in one of the local markets. A very friendly and polite person by nature, Zulmat obtained her clientele very quickly. The business is stable and generates the main income for the family.

Today, Zulmat is planning to increase her working capital in order to expand her business. She needs additional funds to purchase new curtains to sell. Thus, Zulmat is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni. Zulmat had taken loans from IMON several times before and has proved herself to be a reliable client. She thanks all for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payments.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her working capital and expand her business by purchasing new goods to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Carmen viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, luego los procesa en harinas, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad e Pisco a donde viaja semanalmente, y de Pisco trae pallar, tomate, camote entre otros productos que vende en el mercado de abastos.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, trigo.
Los sueños de Carmen son tener una tienda en su casa y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to Señor de Huanca Communal Bank. Carmen lives with her life partner, is 40 years old, and has one child. Carmen travels to different fairs in her area to sell cereals. After she processes them in flour, she markets her products in the city and in Pisco, where she goes weekly, and brings butter bean, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes, among other products she sells at the wholesale markets. Carmen needs a loan of S./3000, which she will use to buy corn and wheat. Carmen dreams of running a store in her house, and of finishing building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and wheat

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. Chheng S. is a farmer in Kgnauk Pong village in Takeo province. She cultivates rice on a piece of land she owns. She needs some money to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on her field. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Haem Noub, a recycling collector. is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on her rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Ikuju

texts.en:
Ikuju R. is currently in the business of selling milk and cheese and is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Ikuju is 29 years old and married.  Her husband is a cattle keeper. They have two children.  With the extra profits she will earn from her shop, she hopes to be able to construct a house which she will rent out.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop.

loans.name: Jakline

texts.en:
Jakline is a 33 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with her husband and their child. Jakline has been perfumes essence since 2003. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new perfumes essence that are more adapted for the winter season. Jakline has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. 
Jakline is special in her work because she is the only one in her region selling perfume essence. Her clients can be anybody from or outside her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of cash to expand her stock. Jakline decided on doing her business because she used to work in a perfume factory and she learned the business. In the future, she plans on improving her work by changing her shop location and having a bigger shop.

loans.use: To purchase new perfumes essence.

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi sells foodstuffs and crates of eggs at retail prices to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in the business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more crates of eggs and foodstuffs to sell. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 36 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Massigui, sous préfecture de MASSIGUI, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles  sont liées par des liens de commerce, de parentés et font toutes le commerce d’articles divers en vue d’amoindrir les charges de leur mari. 
Elles viennent de connaitre l’institution grâce à leurs camarades de la place.
Ces femmes ont alors décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et le premier prêt a été bien remboursé. 
Elles comptent utiliser le nouveau prêt pour  acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et d’articles divers. Les condiments sont achetés sur le marché de Massigui, quant aux autres produits ils sont achetés en grande partie à Dioïla et Fana et sont revendus au marché de MASSIGUI à une clientèle composée de femmes et    d’hommes.  
Elles estiment réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 26 000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre la nourriture, la santé et  le réinvestissement dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are married women with an average age of 36 and 2 children, They live with their husband and children in large traditional families in the village of Massigui, in the Massigui prefecture, in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through business and kinship ties and all sell a range of items with a view to reducing their husband’s responsibilities. They learned of the institution through their friends. These women therefore decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in the hope of having a steady income for their businesses.

They are on their second group loan and the first one was repaid correctly. They plan on using the new loan to buy a large quantity of condiments and miscellaneous items. The condiments are purchased from the Massigui market, and the other items are mainly bought in Djoïla and Fana and are resold in the Massigui market to both male and female customers.

Each member expects to earn an average profit of 26,000 FCFA per month. The profits will be shared out between food, health products and reinventing in their businesses.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and miscellaneous items

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: A. Eugénie est née vers 1951 et est mariée à ALLAGBE Bernard, un menuisier. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés.  Eugénie vit depuis près de 20 ans à Gbégamey à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Eugénie vit avec tous ses enfants, et vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Eugénie n’a pas été à l’école. C’est depuis 50 ans que Eugénie mène comme activité, la vente de produits vivriers (riz, haricot, maïs) ainsi que des divers (sardines, tomates en boîtes, lait, couscous, savons, petit pois, pâtes alimentaires, bougies, etc.) à Allada. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et à Bohicon dans le Zou au Bénin, que Eugénie s’approvisionne. Eugénie a bénéficié une fois de crédit à ALIDé et a bien remboursé le crédit. En vue d’accroître son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Eugénie sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Eugénie was born around 1951 and is married to ALLAGBE Bernard, a furnture maker. The couple has three children who are all in school. For nearly twenty years, she has been living in Gbégamey in Allada, in Atlantique county. She lives with all her children, and she works in aid of her husband to support the family. Eugénie has not gone to school. For fifty years, she has been running a business selling staple goods (rice, beans, corn), as well as a variety of goods (sardines, canned tomatoes, milk, couscous, soaps, peas, pasta, candles, etc.) in Allada. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and in Bohicon, in Zou, in Benin. She benefited once from an ALIDé loan, which she repaid. With the aim of growing her business and to cope better with customer demand, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple foods (tubs of rice, beans, and corn) and canned foods

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La señorita Mary  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 22 años de edad,es soltera, no tiene hijos y siguiò estudios superiores completos. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado como ovejas.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fuè de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales menores.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de animales como: oveja y porcino.

Su deseo para el futuro es abrir una tienda de computadoras y tener trabajo propio.

Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son las reuniones que se dan.
texts.en:
Miss Mary is a member of the Communal Bank "24 of June", she lives in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 22 years old, single, has no children, and continued to study college. She works buying and selling livestock such as sheep. She has been working wih the Movimieno Manuela Ramos for 6 months now, and in her communal bank her first loan was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy small animals. She is requesting a loan for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying animals such as sheep and pigs. Her hope for the future is to open a computer store and to have her own job. What she likes the best about her organization is the gatherings they organize.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sheep and pigs

loans.name: Meyling Jaqueline

texts.es:
La  Señorita Meyling Jaqueline G. E., tiene la edad de 24 años, Labora como maestra y tiene un hijos a su cargo, este se encuentran  en edad escolar, es soltera, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizará para la remodelación y cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señorita Meyling Jacqueline Gutiérrez E. is 24 years old, and works as a teacher in the Eastern Market of Managua. She has one school-aged son, she is single, and she has worked with loans with CEPRODEL for a few years. Over this period of time she has invested one loan in the improvement of the home in which she lives. Thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, she is an excellent customer. The requested loan is to be able to invest in the purchase of construction materials. It will be used for the remodeling and change in the roof of the home in which she lives, with the objective to give greater security and better living conditions to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mrs. Sa Um Nak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Um N. is village bank president. Her village bank loan group consists of 14 people who live in PraSat Village in Takeo Province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sa Um N. is 41 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Mrs. Sa Um N. is a farmer who grows rice on a plot of land that she owns. Her husband, Mr. Sovann Tous, is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small income to support his family. Although she and her family work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cattle-breeding business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Forty-five-year old Lilibeth is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 25 years old. She is involved in rice farming. There are also bananas and other fruit trees planted on part of her land. She sells these around her community to add income to her family.

Lilibeth is now applying for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, a Kiva partner, which she will use to supply her farm with lacking inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She chose to be a member of CEVI because of its low-interest rate and insurance policy.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Francisco A. I. tiene 59 años de edad, es casado. Francisco se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 14 años. su negocio esta ubicado en el barrio morazan de la ciudad de Nacaome.
según algunas fuentes don francisco siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de pan con la diferencia que ahora el tiene su propio carro y traslada su producto para vender por las diferentes aldeas, caserios, barrios y colonias de esta ciudad.
ahora tiene una mayor demanda en la venta de su pan.
su mayor sueño es tener su propia fabrica de pan para poder emplear a muchas personas y asi obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. I. is 59 years old and is married. Francisco has been selling bread for 14 years. His business is located in the neighborhood of Morazán, in the city of Nacaome. According to some sources, Mr. Francisco has always been selling bread with the difference that now he has his own car, and he can transport his product to sell in the various villages, hamlets, and neighborhoods of this city. He now has a higher demand for his bread. His biggest dream is to have his own bakery to employ many people and earn better profits from his business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy W. is 35 years old. She has been selling used clothes in Naivasha town for the past five years, and she says her business has been good. She prices her clothes with the right price for her target market. 

She got to know about KADET through one of the company's awareness campaigns in Naivasha town. This will be her third loan from KADET, and her credit history in paying loans is very good. She plans to use proceeds from this loan to add more clothes for sale, in particular men’s shirts and ladies blouses, which are on high demand.

She hopes to one day to move to a more permanent place rather than selling from the roadside.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and blouses for sale

loans.name: Busayo

texts.en:
Busayo own a grocery store where she sells items like milk, tomato paste, eggs, drinks and more. She manages the business with her family in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Busayo is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. Having more goods in her shop attracts more customers, increases her sales and makes more profit. This will enable her to save and reinvest into the business, which will lead to expansion of the business in the future. 

She is 45 years old, married and blessed with three children. They are all doing well and live in Lagos, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Mrs. Phou L. is 47 years old and lives in Khsom village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Thet Kong, are farmers who own a 1.20-hectare (3-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

In this faming, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm crops. Thus, Mrs. Phou L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to support the farm crops.

Mrs. Phou L. is the mother of six children: one is a seamstress in the garment factory while the others are students in the local school and also support their parents’ farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her rice field

loans.name: Marco A.

texts.es:
El señor Marco A. Calderón vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Tembladerani, ubicado en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Marco trabaja como empleado de una empresa de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una computadora, imprescindible para sus estudios ya que esta cursando los últimos cursos para graduarse de contador.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco A C. lives in his parent's house in the Tembladerani neighborhood on the western side of the city of La Paz. Sr. Marco works for a company in the city and his income pays his basic expenses. He will use the loan to buy a computer, something he has to have for school. He is taking the last classes he needs to get a degree in accounting. This is the first time that he has applied for a loan. A socio-economic analysis indicates that he is a good candidate for a loan and should be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer that is needed to complete accounting degree.

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas 4,5,6 Group

texts.en:
Regina is the coordinator of her group, Vecinas Unidas (United Neighbors), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL., an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her long-term partner and two children.
Regina is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry by purchasing earrings, necklaces and bracelets for her store. She will use the profits to purchase medicine, school supplies and a computer for her children. She will also save towards her dream of building her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase earrings, necklaces and bracelets for resale

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros, "lord Of Miracles" Group

texts.es:
Irene tiene una bodega en su casa por mas D. 15 años, su negocio lleva por nombre” BODEGA  YACKY” aun recuerda cuando recién llego a  su zona  D. residencia, era un lugar donD. no había  luz ni agua, habían muy pocas casas  pero al ver que poco a poco se iba poblando y la  necesidad D. la gente aumentaba decidió implementar en su casa un lugarcito, empezó  vendiendo marcianos (helados) y gaseosas después se abasteció D. otras cosas según le iban pidiendo,  logrando  así en la actualidad  tener una bodega mas granD.  junto a esto ha podido ahorrar y construir su casa donD. esta proyectando instalar otra tienda para poner una bodega  minimarket y  también quiere concretar otro negocio D. venta D. frutas. Actualmente esta incursionando en la venta D. cervezas al por mayor las que reparte para actividades sociales, Irene se siente feliz por que gracias a los prestamos D. EDAPROSPO ella ha visto crecer su negocio con sus anteriores prestamos pudo comprarse una congeladora, exhibidora y  refrigeradora lo que es indispensable para su negocio, en esta oportunidad usara su préstamo para comprar cervezas y seguir en el negocio que hace poco ha iniciado ,el grupo que ella conforma se llama “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS” y esta feliz D. pertenecer al grupo .

*a Sra. Irene es la cuarta D. las paradas(D. izq.a derecha)
texts.en:
Irene has had a small store in her house for more than 15 years. Her business is called "Bodega Yacky." She still remembers that when she arrived in the area, there was no electricity or running water and there were very few houses. Little by little the population grew, and with it the needs of the people. She decided to open a small place in her house and began selling "marcianos," or ice cream, and sodas. Later she stocked up on other things that were requested until now she has a a larger store next to this and she has been able to save and build a house where she is projecting that she will put another store with a grocery mini-market. She would also like to establish another business selling fruit. Currently she is venturing into the sale of beer at wholesale for social events. Irene is happy that thanks to the loans of EDAPROSPO she has been able to see her business grow. With her previous loans she could buy a freezer, display case, and refrigerator - which have been indispensable for her business. With this opportunity she will use her loan to buy beer and continue with the business that she began recently. The group she is a part of is called "Senor D. los Milagros" or "Lord of Miracles" and she is happy to belong to the group. *Going left to right, Mrs. Irene is the fourth woman of those standing.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Beer for her Business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. S. presently resides with other family members in the capital, Phnom Pen. He is married with a young child who is not enrolled in school. His wife works as a garment laborer in the factory.

S., age 27, acquired the skill of building wooden houses from his grandfather and is currently using his knowledge to earn his daily income. He is hired by people to repair or construct their new houses for a fee and has a few laborers who help him to provide this service.

Recently, S. has received a project to build a new house for a customer, but he is concernsed that he lacks some construction materials to perform this service. So, he decided to request a loan to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To buy some construction materials

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian A. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Lilian is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Lilian owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products like sweet and sour crushed papaya  and fresh cucumber salad in the local community. Lilian also sells fruit. She has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lilian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan S. is from the village of Cawa-Cawa. She is 33 years old. Roxan is married and has 2 school-aged children and 1 infant child. To make a living, Roxan owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Roxan is just starting this business.

In 2008, Roxan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roxan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Roxan is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Roxan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Crescelinda

texts.en:
Crescelinda G. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Crescelinda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Crescelinda owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Crescelinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP every four months.

In 2007, Crescelinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Crescelinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Irene Kerubo

texts.en:
Irene is a 34 year old married mother of three children. She runs a beauty salon in Umoja Nairobi. She has been in the business for a period of about two years, with a profit of about KES 15,000 per month.  

She wants to use her loan to restock her salon with more beauty products. She was introduced to KADET by the group members. She hopes to open another salon and to start a hair and beauty college.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya N. lives in Namungoona, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 2 children, one of whom is in school.

Yudaya has a business of selling samosas and chapatti. She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 5 days out of every week. Yudaya sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Yudaya has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil, wheat flour, and charcoal.

The main business challenge(s) for Yudaya include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy land and start farming. She decided to work with MCDT because it reaches out to clients at a grassroots level. Yudaya lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of cooking oil, wheat flour, and charcoal.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She sells women’s clothing items, e.g.. jeans, sportswear, etc., in one of the city markets. She started this venture with the help of lending assistance in order to get going. She has now been in business for sixteen years. Currently, her turnover is about 30,000 Grivnyas and her monthly net profit is about 10,000 Grivnyas.

Irina loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given her, not only to provide for herself, but also to help her family. The current loan of 15,000 Grivnas will help her business stay stable this fall season, the financial crisis having affected many small businessmen all around Ukraine.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise assortment

loans.name: Martha Paubla

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia hace 6 ciclos del  Banco Comunal 8 De Mayo, que se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, rodeada por maravillosas playas  de clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras.

Empieza su conversación diciendo que le encanta lo que hace el Banco Comunal y la Fundación Espoir para ayudar a muchas personas como ella a instalar su negocio. Ella tiene 43 años, esta casada y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos ya es casado y vive aparte, su esposo es empleado público.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, además vende sabanas que son muy solicitadas por su calidad ya que ella ofrece un buen producto comenta. Trabaja de miércoles a domingo en las tardes, realiza sus entregas y  cobros ya que ella deja a crédito sus productos, los fines de mes viaja a la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar toda su mercadería y en ciertas ocasiones  se va hasta Huaquillas donde compra mercadería de otros países. Ahora también quiere vender ropa interior y sandalias para damas.
Es así como va a invertir este crédito en comprara mitad ropa interior y la otra parte en sandalias.
 
Sus metas son tener éxito en las nuevas  ventas que va a realizar.
texts.en:
Señora Martha has been an associate of the 8th of May communal bank for 6 loan cycles. The group meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the beauty queen capital, surrounded by marvelous beaches with a warm and agreeable climate, beautiful women and female wrestlers. She began her conversation saying that she is please with what the communal bank and the Hope Foundation do to help many people like her start their business. She is 43 years of age, married and has 2 children, one of whom is married and lives apart from her. Her husband is a public employee. She is dedicated to the sale of clothing of all types. In addition she sells sheets which are much sought after for their quality, since she offers a good product commentary. She works from Wednesday to Sunday. In the afternoons she makes her deliveries and collections, since she sells her product on credit. At the end of the month she travels to the city of Guayaquil to buy all her merchandise. On certain occasions she goes to Huaquillas where she buys merchandise from other countries. Now she also wants to sell underwear and sandals for ladies. She is going to invest half of this loan in purchasing underwear and the other part in buying sandals. Her goal is to be successful in the new sales that she is going to carry out.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy undergarments and sandals for resale

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo H. V. de 45 años de edad, es un padre soltero, quien vive junto a su madre la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así mismo vive junto a tres hijos menores de edad, junto a los cuales reside en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Rodrigo es un hombre muy trabajador el cual comercializa productos de aluminio como: cacerolas, depósitos, moldes para hornear y otros más. Él trabaja de forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos en Sensuntepeque y en Ilobasco, siempre dentro del mismo departamento. Rodrigo solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos de aluminio, sobretodo moldes para hacer pan y para hornear pollo, ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año en donde se vende mayor cantidad de estos productos. Rodrigo es una persona muy responsable quien vela por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Rodrigo H. V. is a 45 year-old single father who lives with his mother, who devotes herself to the household tasks, and his 3 minor children.  They live together in Sensuntepeque in the Cuscatlán department.  Rodrigo is a very hardworking man who sells aluminum products such as: pans, large pots, bakeware, and other products.  He sells on the street, offering his products in Sensuntepeque and Ilobasco, which are both in the same department.  Rodrigo requests a loan to buy a greater quantity of aluminum products, especially pans used to make bread and to roast chicken, since the end-of-year festivities are approaching, which is when he sells the greatest number of these products.  Rodrigo is a very responsible person who looks after the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy aluminum products to sell

loans.name: Marisol Alexandra

texts.es:
Marisol de 24 años, es vendedora informal de artículos plásticos. Vive con sus dos hijos de 6 y 9 años en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas).

Comenzó a vender los artículos plásticos hace ya 8 años atrás, sus primeros artículos fueron plateras, platos. Poco a poco fue surtiendo su mercadería debido al esfuerzo que puso en su trabajo pudo aumentar algunas cosas en su casa. Su forma de trabajo en recorriendo las calles de paraíso desde las 08h00 después que sale a deja a sus dos hijos a la escuela. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar platos, tachos plásticos para tener mas variedad en su mercadería. En el futuro quiere arreglar su casa que ahora es de caña y continuar superándose por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marisol is 24 years old and sells plastic items informally.  She lives with her two children, ages 6 and  9, in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban zone, characterized by dirt roads and houses situated in the mountains).  

She started selling plastic products 8 years ago.  Her first items were plastic utensils and plates.  Little by little, she increased her merchandise inventory and due to the effort she put into her business she was able to acquire some things for her house.  She works as a travelling salesperson on the streets of Paraíso from 8:00 in the morning until her two children get home from school.  

With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy plates and plastic bins in order to have a wider variety of merchandise.  In the future, she wants to fix her house that is now made of cane and to continue excelling for her children.

loans.use: To purchase plastic plates and bins to sell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: ablavi est une femme qui a appris la couture, pour augmenter ses revenus elle s'est lancée dans le commerce des articles de mercerie. elle s'approvisionne au ghana voisin, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.  elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers articles de mercerie. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Ce crédit va lui permettre de satisfaire les besoins de fin d'année de sa clientèle
texts.en: Ablavi G. is a woman who learned how to sew. She began selling sewing notions to increase her revenue. She gets her supplies in neighboring Ghana and her clientele consists of all types of people. She wants to stock up and is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase a variety of sewing notions. She is married and the mother of two children. This loan will enable her to meet the year-end needs of her clientele.

loans.use: Purchase sewing notions

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía A. de la ciudad de Caacupé.
 Son mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras, muchas de ellas cabezas de familia. 
Están muy agradecidas por el apoyo económico y la confianza que les brinda la Fundación, gracias a los créditos y las constantes capacitaciones que reciben están saliendo adelante, están pudiendo ayudar al sustento de sus familias, e ir creciendo comercialmente.
El comité ha culminado su ciclo crediticio número 10, están teniendo una línea de crédito por encima de los un millón de guaraníes, y cada vez se unen mas señoras con ganas de salir adelante, que escuchan del programa y que ven como las antiguas están aumentando sus ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rosa quien de dedica a la venta de cosméticos. 
Ella trabaja en la venta de sus productos sobre pedido, y ofrece mediante catálogos que posee de los productos que ella vende.
Más adelante desea abrir una botique donde puede ofrecer además de cosméticos, ropas y calzados. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos que desea compra ya que recibió muchos pedidos especialmente de perfumes.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from A. in the town of Caacupé.

They are very hard-working, determined women.  Many of them are heads of families.  They are very grateful for the financial support and trust which Fundación Paraguaya is providing them with.  Thanks to the loans and the constant training which they receive, they are managing to get ahead in life and are able to support their families and grow their businesses.

The committee members have just finished their 10th loan cycle.  They now have a line of credit of more than one million guaranís and more and more women keep joining their committee with a desire to get ahead in life.  They listen to the program and see how the existing members are increasing their incomes and thereby improving their quality of life.

One of the members is Rosa who sells cosmetics.  She sells her products to order and offers them through catalogs which show the products she sells.  In the future, she would like to open a store where she can offer clothes and footwear as well as cosmetics.  She is requesting her loan so that she can buy cosmetics as she has a lot of orders to fill, especially for perfume.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista E. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. Teopista lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

Teopista has operated a business selling food at the market for 10 years, and she works 6 days each week. Teopista has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, and onions. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Teopista are transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and hopes for her business are to start going to farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and onions

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Penh M., 30, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, where she earns a living raising pigs and farming her own farmland. She has been running this business since 2005, and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a firewood seller. They have only two children, both of whom are single and living under their care. This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. Unfortunately, the machine has often broken down during the plowing process. Because of this problem, Penh M. would like a loan to fix her broken cultivating machine.

loans.use: To fix her broken cultivating machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for breakfast and lunch sales

loans.name: Shamim Wanjiku

texts.en:
Shamim Wanjiku S. is 42 years old and married to S. Abed. Together they have three children. Her husband is employed at Eldo millers in Eldoret town, where they live. 

Shamim runs a beauty salon and boutique in the same area and has been in the same business for four years now. She gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Shamim's first loan from KADET Ltd., and she plans to use it to buy cosmetics, a hair dryer and a few items for her boutique business. With the income that she will get, she plans to repay her loan well, pay her rent, and also raise her family's standard of living. 

In the future, she wants to educate her children by taking them to the best schools in Eldoret, and also to diversify her business to start a hotel in Eldoret town.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar S. lives in Thommeakney village in Takeo province and she was born in 1960. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a computer company. The others are attending a local public school.

Sar is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she grows both rice and vegetables for selling to support her family. She is a duck breeder, too. 

She has some problems with her land and it is time for growing rice. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sar S. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza R. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 44 years old. Esperanza is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Esperanza owns & operates a business providing general services to local community members. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esperanza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esperanza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Yunice

texts.en:
Yunice has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, tea, milk, tomatoes and bananas, which are sold to the local market. She also earns income from her business selling clothes to the local market.

She has requested a loan of 25,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Yunice is 36 years old and married with five children whose ages range between 3 and 16. Four of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun R. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Soy, live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children, two attend school and another one is still young. 

Savoeun is a weaver. Her husband is a security guard. In the past, he was a construction worker. Savoeun asked for a Kiva loan once. She hopes to continue her weaving business, so she is asking for her second loan of $600 to purchase weaving materials (cotton threads). She will also use a part of the loan to repair the roof of her house.  

Photo: Mrs. Savoeun R. and her loom

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials and to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Edy Antonio

texts.es: EL SEÑOR C.  LABORA COMO HIGIENISTA, ES CASADO, TIENE  SEIS  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ESTE ES EL  CREDITO # ONCE QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPROTUNIDAD QUE LE BRINDA, ESTE DESEMBOLSO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA PARA PODER COMPRAR  MATERIALES DE CONNSTRUCCION PARA HACER UN ANEXO DE UN CUARTO.
texts.en: Mr C. works as a cleaner.  He is married and has six people in his care.  This is the 11th loan that he has been granted by Ceprodel and he is grateful for the opportunity that he is being offered.  Mr C. needs this loan to invest in improving his home.  He will buy construction supplies in order to build an extension to a room.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to improve his home

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Benard S. W. is 41 years old, married, and a father of four wonderful children.  They live in Kitale town.  Benard sells newspapers and magazines there and has been doing this business for thirteen years.   He earns a monthly income of forty-eight thousand shillings.

This will be Benard's first loan from KADET LTD., and he wants to use the entire loan to add new stock to his business.  He would like to buy new magazines, newspapers etc,.   With the income, he will repay the loan and also expand his business.

In the future, Benard wants to educate his children to the highest level, also to expand and start another business.

loans.use: To buy more stock, like magazines

loans.name: Jose Vincente

texts.es:
José, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y sus padres, tiene 26 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de tortas mexicanas, tiene 6 años de administrar el negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar tomates, repollo, lechuga, bebidas, agua y carne, estos materiales le son necesarios para realizar las tortas y atender a los clientes.
Su aspiración es incrementar las ventas y mejorar las ganancias, de esta manera está mejorando la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en: Jose is from El Transito, San Miguel. He lives with his wife and his parents, and he is 26 years old. Jose has been running a sandwich shop for six years. He has asked for a loan so that he can buy tomatoes, cabbage, lettuce, drinks, water and meat. These goods are essential to making sandwiches and pleasing his customers. Jose hopes to increase his sales and profits, which will improve his family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, lettuce, drinks, water and meat.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Virginia is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling pillows, pillow cases, bed sheets and blankets in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of blankets and pillow cases. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of blankets and pillow cases

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has sold household goods like maize flour and sugar. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood. With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Nuruila's Group

texts.en:
Nuruila is the leader of this group. She is 48 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she has raised five children. The oldest daughter is married, and the other children are students. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 17,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS), Nuruila started to sell children’s clothing. At the moment her business is running well, and she earns 15,000 soms per month. Her daughters help her in running the business. With money received from the loan, Nuruila wants to purchase summer clothes in order to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future she wants to build a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Begimai's Group

texts.en:
Begimai, 25, is a leader of this group of three. She is divorced and has a five-year-old daughter. They reside in the small southern town of Uzgen.

After her divorce Begimai was in despair with thoughts of providing her daughter with everything she needed. Her father’s advice and support helped her to gather herself and start her business of selling vegetables at wholesale. For almost a year Begimai has been involved in transporting them from Uzgen to the nearby town of Kara Kulja.

With a monthly income of 2,000 KGS she has managed to purchase a small piece of land and an automobile. Her 54,000 KGS loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

One of Begimai’s long-term goals and wishes is to construct a house on her land.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with three children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing products in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 37 years old and married with two children aged 10 and 17 years old.  For nine years, she has been operating a green grocery.  She also sells cereals.  She owns rental houses, which earn her extra income.  Previously, she was selling clothes to earn a living.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to boost her business. Cecilia hopes to own more rental houses for more income generation in the future.  She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Chadreque

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de 1 filha que ainda não tem idade escolar. Frequenta o 4º ano da  universidade pedagogica de gestão e administração. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe e seu pai enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas de agua e energia. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é professor ha mais de 8 anos e é do quadro MEC (Ministerio da Educação e Cultura) e tem um salário de cerca de 8.200.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Fez emprestimo na PROCREDIT e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu sétimo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção DE UMA CASA (pedra, barrotes, cimento, areia, e outros) para continuar com a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 4.800.00mt, 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt,e 2.500.00mt,  ambos para a sua obra.
Pretende ampliar a sua casa, e contruir um estaleiro, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Chadreque was born in Boane, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is single and has a daughter who is not old enough to go to school. Chadreque is in the fourth year of Management and Administration at the Universidade Pedagogica (Pedagogical University). He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother and father by sending money to pay their water and energy bills.

He has never left his hometown. For more than eight years he has been a teacher and a MEC (Ministry of Education and Culture) employee. His salary is around 8,200 meticais per month, and he uses it for household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account (at BIM).

Chadreque had a loan with ProCredit and was able to pay it off without any problems. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Chadreque's seventh Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 13,000 meticais to buy construction materials (stone, beams, cement, sand and other items) so he can continue building his house. The previous loans were for 4,800 meticais, 5,000 meticais, 8,000 meticais, 6,000 meticais, 7,000 meticais, and 2,500 meticais. They were all for his house.

He intends to expand his house and build a sales stall, so he will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (stone, beams, cement, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela nació en la provincia de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú), ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella es ama de casa y su esposo Constantino se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte interprovincial de la ruta de Cusco a Ollantaytambo y viceversa en su propio carro. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Mariela requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 

El Banco Comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco,  Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mariela was born in the province of Urubamba (Cuzco, Peru). She is 29 years old and in a common law marriage from which she has one son. At present, she lives in the same city where she was born and where she works. She is a housewife and her husband Constantino works in interprovincial transportation on the route from Cuzco to Ollantaytambo and vice versa in his own car. He has had this business for two years and it is going very well for him, thanks to his hard work.
