Mariela needs the loan for car maintenance. 

The “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” [New Vision of Urubamba] communal bank meets every month in the city of Urubamba (Cuzco, Peru). Cuzco is known for its tourism, its trade, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because in it is one of the seven wonders of the world, “Machu Picchu”.

loans.use: to do car maintenance.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 45 años está viviendo en unión libre con su pareja Francisco el cual trabaja en el campo, juntos han procreado cuatro los cuales todos dependen de dicha pareja todavía ya que todos están estudiando en diferentes niveles empezando por la secundaria hasta primaria, el más grande tiene 16 años y el más pequeño 11 años.
La señora Juana tiene una tienda de abarrotes solo el nombre es por "Miscelánea" en el negocio tiene 5 años de experiencia, ahora solicita el crédito para abastecer su tienda comprando huevo, pan , refrescos, productos entados, detergente, aceite, leche y golosinas. El problema que presenta ahora es que no tiene para abastecer su tienda y casi no tiene mercancía por eso es que está solicitando el crédito. Sus metas son hacer crecer su negocio para meter más ganancia ya que el lugar que tiene es muy pequeño y apenas cabe para tener un refrigerador. “Gracias por el crédito que me han otorgado, voy a echarle muchas ganas para no quedar mal con ustedes”
texts.en:
Doña Juana is 45 years old and lives in a common law relationship with her partner Francisco, who works on a farm.  Together they have four children, who are all still dependent on them, as all four are in different grades in school from elementary to high school.  Their oldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 11.  

Señora Juana has a grocery store this is just called "Miscelánea" [Miscellaneous].  She has 5 years of experience in this business.  She is requesting a loan to stock her store by purchasing eggs, bread, soft drinks, canned goods, detergent, oil, milk, and sweets.  The problem she is having that she doesn't have enough to stock her store and she has very little merchandise.  For this reason she is requesting a loan.  Her goals are to grow her business to increase her income since her location is very small and barely fits a refrigerator.  

"Thank you for the loan you have given me.  I am going to try very hard to remain in good-standing with you."

loans.use: purchase eggs, bread, soft drinks, canned goods, detergent, oil, milk, and sweets.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 57-years-old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Peter owns and operates a used motorcycle business. The family's income comes primarily from motor repair charges. He runs a motor repair shop in the community, fixing various vehicle types to earn a living. He has been doing this job for four years and is earning PHP 3,000 a month, approximately. He has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 15,000 to purchase motor spare parts. 

Peter has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Peter hopes to buy more tools needed in the business to improve service quality and expand product offerings.

loans.use: to purchase motor spare parts.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos.

Francisco aprendió a fabricar hamacas desde los 10 años, su abuela le enseñó el oficio despues de que la madre de Francisco falleciera. Dedicandose a la agricultura y a la fabricación de hamacas Francisco pudo criar a todos sus hijos, quienes se dedican al mismo oficio.

Francisco solicitó un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de pita y zoga para la elaboración de hamacas. El préstamo le facilitará a Francisco el poder comprar sus insumos en mayores cantidades, y asi pagar un precio más bajo (precio de mayorista). De esta forma Francisco podrá tener una mejor utilidad.

En un futuro Fracisco planea tener otra actividad aparte de las hamacas. Planea comercializar ganado y cerdos. Le gustaría tener su propia granja y asi poder seguir sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is 64 years old.  He is married with 5 children.  He learned to how weave hammocks ten years ago. His grandmother taught him the trade after his mother died.  In addition to weaving hammocks, he is also a farmer. These jobs have enabled him to raise his children, who are engaged in the same businesses.  The loan will make it possible for Francisco to buy his supplies in bulk at a lower, wholesale price.  In this way, Francisco will earn a better profit.  In the future, Francisco plans to engage in other activities besides making hammocks.  He plans to market cattle and pigs.  He would like to have his own farm, which would enable him to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave hammocks.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en: Ma. Cristina works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Ma. Cristina requested a loan for 3,100 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season. She also wants to minimize her kerosene expenses. Ma. Cristina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Los Nuevos Amigos (Calceta) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Nuevos Amigos se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”, por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace cuatro meses atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Miriam, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11,  10 y de 1 año de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es guardia de seguridad.

Ella se dedica a la venta de  sabanas, sobrecamas y ropa por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella trabaja más a base de  pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h30 ya que a esa hora tiene que preparar el almuerzo para cuando lleguen sus hijos de la escuela y en la tarde no sale porque tiene que ayudar a sus hijos, pero si atiende a los clientes que llegan hasta su casa, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Lleva 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más sabanas, sobrecamas y ropa por catalogo. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Los Nuevos Amigos" (New Friends) meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city described as incomparable due to the beauty of its women and because the locals consider it the most beautiful city in the world.

This group of people decided to get together four months ago and form this Communal Bank, which has been a great help to them in improving their small businesses. They are engaged in various activities such as trading, providing services, selling meals and so on.

Señora Miriam is a local. She is 29 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has three children aged 11, 10 and one. The eldest two are studying in school. Her husband is a security guard.

She works at selling sheets, bedspreads and clothing through a catalog. She sells door-to-door and also from home in the case of her best-known customers. She works mostly from customer orders received. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 11.30 a.m. Then she prepares lunch for when her children come in from school. She does not go out in the afternoon as she has to help her children, but she does attend to customers who come to the house. She gives her customers credit and then collects payment on the weekends. She has dedicated the last four years to this business and it is going well.

She will use this loan to buy more sheets, bedspreads and clothing by catalog. This is her first loan cycle in the Communal Bank and she likes the speed with which the loans are issued.

Her dream is that her children should want for nothing.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads and clothing.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sak, 53, a resident of Ang Snoul district, is in two businesses: she is a rice cultivator and a bicycle keeper at a local school. She has been involved in agricultural work, from which she is able to earn $3.00 per day, for many years.  She has a life partner in her husband and four children, two of whom are single and live on her income as well.

 Now she would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy a calf for raising. With the remaining funds, she’ll pay for a lot that she has rented from the school in order to run a bicycle keeping business continually this year.

loans.use: to buy a calf to raise and to pay for a rented lot.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.en: Geronimo is 26 years old and is married. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has 5 years of experience in this field. He earns about PHP 25,000. Geronimo is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity for the development of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Suyapa Del Socorro

texts.es: Suyapa del Socorro tiene 4 hijos menores de edad bajo su cargo. Su actividad es la venta de raspados, desde hace más de 14 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella inicio cuando conoció a su esposo y juntos decidieron dedicarse a este negocio que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos del hogar, por lo que Suyapa tiene que recorrer muchos lugares en busca de sus clientes, a pesar de ser una trabajo agotador ella siempre tiene una animo entusiasta. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de leche, hielo, botellas, llantas y proporcionarle algunas mejoras a su carrito.
texts.en: Suyapa del Socorro is responsible for four minor children. For the past fourteen years she has been selling snow cones. She began this business when she met her husband. They decided to pursue this business as it helps with the household expenses. Suyapa has to walk to many places in order to find customers. Even though it is hard work, Suyapa is always energetic and enthusiastic. The reason for this loan is she wants to buy milk, ice, bottles, and tires in order to make some improvements to her cart.

loans.use: to buy milk, ice, bottles and tires.

loans.name: Cejerina

texts.en:
Cejerina is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Cejerina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 37 years old and is married with two children. He is a rice farmer who earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each harvest season, in April and November. 

Ricardo is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and insecticides for use in farming, which he has been doing for 10 years. 

In the future, Ricardo hopes to further enhance his crop production so that he can earn enough funds for the college education of his children.  He would also like to be able to save some money to pay for any unexpected family expenses that might arise.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a 46-year-old widow and entrepreneur who lives with her five children in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Monngolia, without basic infrastructure. Two of her children attend local high school and institute. The other three are working at the Wagner Asia company. 

From  2005 to 2009 she worked as a chef. After that she supported her family by operating a cosmetics sales business at the local small indoor market. She has 1,800,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She rents one small stall and sells a wide range of cosmetic products such as hair colors, shampoos, toothpastes, hair gels, toilet tissues, wet tissues, face creams, etc. 

After the Christmas and New Year holidays, her business needs money to purchase more products in order to increase working capital. Thus, she is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase cosmetic products to sell in her stall.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Jumabubu

texts.ru: Жумабубу 55 лет, замужем, воспитала семерых детей. Жумабубу проработала 35 лет учителем начальных классов и известна как очень целеустремленный, ответственный и трудолюбивый человек. Свою любовь к знаниям Жумабубу смогла передать и своим детям, получившим высшее образование в сферах медицины,  инженерии, лингвистики. Получение образования стало возможным благодаря основной деятельности семьи Жумабубу – это откорм и перепродажа скота.  Начатое еще в 1990 году со  стартовой суммой в 25,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.   В данный момент, в хозяйстве Жумабубу 4 дойные коровы,15 голов овец, 9 голов коз. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Жумабубу обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 133,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Это позволит ей увеличить своей хозяйство и приумножить поголовье скота, сделав, таким образом по ее мнению, наилучшее капиталовложение. В будущем - Жумабубу хотела бы построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Jumabubu is 55 years old, married and raised seven children.  She spent 35 years working as a primary grades teacher and is known as a very goal-oriented, responsible and hardworking person.  Jumabubu was able to pass her love of knowledge onto her children, who obtained higher education degrees in the fields of medicine, engineering and linguistics.  Obtaining education became possible thanks to Jumabubu's family's primary business, which is fattening up and reselling livestock.  This business, started in 1990 with an initial sum of 25,000 som (KGS), today yields about 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  Currently, Jumabubu's business has 4 dairy cows, 15 heads of sheep, and 9 heads of goats.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Jumabubu requested a loan in the sum of 133,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional livestock.  This will allow her to expand her business and increase livestock headcount; thus, in her opinion, making the best investment of capital.  In the future, Jumabubu wants to build a large house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Stephanie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Stephanie is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Stephanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipent.

loans.name: Teodura

texts.en:
Teodura  hails from the town of Corella. She raises hogs, which help her managed the economy of her household.
She is married and has three grown children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been raising hogs for a quite period of time now.


She would like to boost her earnings by raising  more quality hogs and having sufficient supply of feed to become  healthy and that is attractive to buyers.   In that way, her income will improve and she would like to invest other means of living to become more successful.

Teodura  is looking forward to have a stable source and extend thanks for the support.

loans.use: to buy feed and pig supplement

loans.name: Evodia

texts.en: Evodia is 29 years old,married with two children. Evodia had only primary education,her parents could not afford sending her to midlle school. After being married Evodia could not stand being a house wife only. She joined various ‘women empowering groups’ which in turn helped her build a network of friends who helped her start a business. Today Evodia runs two businesses successfully. She owns a charcoal store near her residence and a cloth shop in Tandika market. Evodia is enthuastic and optomistic about one day becoming a succesfull business-woman. Starting with her current businesses, she is planning to increase the size and stability of operations. She believes that operating in large scale helps in pushing costs down. She will use this loan to implement her plans.

loans.use: Add stock of cloths and charcoal

loans.name: Shamila

texts.en:
Shamila lives in District 3 of Kabul City and is married. She has taken the loan for her son who runs a tailoring shop. At the start of her son's business they had few materials for tailoring, so they had few customers. It was difficult for them to keep going with their shop because they had to use the income from the shop to pay its rent. Then Shamila heard about Small Loans and she decided to start taking loans. Shamila is now in her first loan cycle and with this loan amount she would like to purchase more fabric in order to make more clothes and a machine with which her son can make clothes faster. She is pleased with the loan procedure because with the amount not only can they expand their business but they can also fulfill their daily expenses.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the son of the female entrepreneur, Shamila. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the Internet, but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Shamila would like to buy fabric, needles, thread, etc. and a machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Mrs. Abla is married with 4 children. She has sold corn, yams, and beans for one year. Her activity makes her able to satisfy all the daily needs of her family. Taking this loan will continue to enforce good relationships with her neighbours because she will continue to be able to provide food for the neighbourhood. Right now she is able to give food to her neighbours on loan so that they may feed their families one day and pay her another. This loan will permit her to expand the inventory and to sell other food items.

With $100, she wants to build a stand in order to keep her goods fresh and safe from the weather. The remaining money will be used to expand the inventory.

loans.use: To expand the inventory and to build a stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase fish stock

loans.name: Miezan Elisabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Miessan Elizabeth A. is a fresh vegetables seller in Treichville market in the southern area of the city of Abidjan. She was born in 1955. She has 23 years of experience and is very happy to have a career at the market. Her goal now is to develop her activities, so she joined AE&I a few months ago after she heard about it from her eldest son.

Miessan Elizabeth is the mother of 2 boys, who are both studying at the state university of Cocody in Cote d'Ivoire.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Chantorn

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Chantorn (age 53) and her husband married in 1979. They have five children, four of whom still live at home as well as one son-in-law and two grandchildren. One daughter studies at college. They are requesting their first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $800. They will use this loan to purchase dishware, utensils, and food supplies for her cafe/restaurant.

While Chantorn’s husband works as a security guard, his job for the past eight years, the family’s primary source of income is the food and drink stand she operates in front of their house. She’s been doing this for the past three years and her business continues to grow. She told us that she learned to cook professionally during an eight-year period in the office of a Cambodian senator. Her current clientele are comprised of people from her village and passers-by on the road that runs past her shop. On a good day she can serve up to 50 customers.

She currently prepares and sells basic noodle and soup dishes commonly referred to as “Khmer Noodles”. She hopes to refine her shop and menu so she can sell a range of more complex and expensive fare referred to as “Chinese Noodles”. The main difference between these two styles of cooking comes from the expense of ingredients, the method of preparation, and formality of dining. A typical serving of Khmer Noodles costs about US $0.25 while a serving of Chinese Noodles costs $0.63.

Chantorn’s main goal in growing her business is to better support her one child who studies at college.

loans.use: To purchase dishware, utensils, and food supplies for her business.

loans.name: Toaga

texts.en: Toaga is married to a farmer from the village of Saaga, very far from town. She has four children, three boys and one girl. Her husband has no job and that was the main reason she joined SPBD, to get a loan to support her 2-acre taro plantation, just 50 meters from her house. She sells 3-4 bags of taro twice a week and she gets $120-160 USD a week. She also does business with the Saaga Fou centre. She used to make a deposit of $40 USD every two weeks, just to support her business, family and for her childrens' school fees.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en:
Ibodat is 26 years old. She and her husband-entrepreneur have two small wonderful kids

Ibodat is a seamstress. When she was a girl, Ibodat was trained by her grandmother to sew Tajikistan's national dresses and national quilts. In Tajikistan the national dresses are very beautiful and an important part of the dowry for any girl. The national quilts are also very popular as they are widely used in the country. People use them as mattresses and blankets. Ibodat sews the dresses and quilts in her house and sells them from there.

Ibodat has been an IMON client for more than 2 years already. She has paid all of her loans on time. Now Ibodat requests US$500 for which she plans to purchase fabrics for sewing the national dresses and quilts. Ibodat is sure she will repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of new fabrics for sewing national dresses and national quilts

loans.name: Aneesa's Group

texts.en: My name is Aneesa B. and I have five children, three sons and two daughters. All of my children are under the age of 15; three attend a local school and two are not yet of school age. I am a textile artist and create embroidered dresses that are embellished with sequins and beads. My brother sells these outfits at his shop in Karachi, a big city in Pakistan.  I need to increase my income by expanding my business. With the increased profits I hope to make, I plan to renovate my house and save for my children's future. The other members of my group who need loans are: Humaira B., who is borrowing for her husband's TV cable agency. Jameela B. plans to invest her share of this loan in her family’s paper business. Khailda B. runs a boutique. Rashida B. embroiders and makes clothing on order. This is a group loan and we are all responsible for repaying it.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business and several other small companies

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Mrs. Genara is a member of the Community Bank Women to Progress. She has a hardware store in front of the Nation Bank of the district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash.

With the proceeds of the loan of S/ 2000 (USD $725) which will be repaid in 8 installments, she will buy 2 water pumps, 3 packages of light bulbs, 4 electric showers. She will also purchase 6 dozen notebooks, book covers, mechanical pencils, hole punchers for the students.

She is 48 years old and has 4 children. Her husband makes a living duplicating keys. They both work to improve their household.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Genara, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, tiene su ferretería ubicado frente al Banco D. la Nación del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará, 2 bombas D. agua, 3 paquetes D. focos, 4 duchas eléctricas, también comprara 6 docenas D. cuadernos, vinifan, lapiceros, poncheras para los estudiantes.

Ella tiene 48 años D. edad, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo se dedica hacer duplicado D. llaves ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su hogar.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is a small business owner from Ordzhonikidze, a city in the central part of Ukraine. He works to support his family by selling clothing at a busy outdoor market in Ordzhonikidze. Igor has been in business for about three years and makes around $700 per month. Eventually he would like to open a second vending location to increase his sales and profits.

Igor has requested a short term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to add to his working business capital. He has developed a good reputation and credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist Igor with the success of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
The group consists of four people: Julia L., Eugenio B., Antonio C., and Roberto C.. They are former loan recipients who guarantee each other’s loans. Although they all have businesses in the same area, they live in different places with their respective families. They've been responsible borrowers for a long time--this is their 26th loan. They are all from humble backgrounds, so each of them is struggling to put his/her own business on a sound footing. If this were achieved, they would be able to provide a better life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Grupo compuesto por 4 persaonas:Julia L.,Eugenio B.,Antonio C. y Roberto C. clientes antiguos que se garantizan mutuamente, todos tienen su negocio por la misma Zona, pero viven en diferentes lugares con sus respectivas familias. Durante todo este tiempo han trabajado de manera responsable encontrandose en su secuencia 26, cada cliente y sus familias son de condiciones humildes por lo cual cada uno ellos lucha para sacar su propio negiocio a flote y asi poder brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus respectivas familias.

loans.use: Money to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Bushra Mumtaz Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji, wife of M. A., has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the past thirteen years. She is the mother of two sons - Qamar, who is thirteen years old and reads in the sixth standard, and Faisal, age ten, who reads in the fourth standard. Her husband is a trader by profession, and buys and sells wheat. Bushra baji is applying for a loan for her husband's business to increase his income and improve the financial condition of the household.

Bushra baji's loan group has four other women as members. They are Saima baji, Zahida baji, Sumera baji and Safia baji. Zahida baji wants the loan to repair her auto-rickshaw. Sumera baji needs funds to expand her thread business and Safia baji will use the loan to expand her candy business.

This is a group loan and the funds will be distributed among the members. They mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has grown children who live in a different country. He lives in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. Alexander runs a small business selling general goods in the local market. His kiosk is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Alexander has been in business for over seven years. His wife actively helps him with operations. Currently, his monthly gross income is about $2,000.

Alexander is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.

Alexander is requesting a loan for 3000 Grivnas ($US675) to increase the assortment of inventory in his kiosk. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Alexander's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship. 

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Francisca Susana

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca Susana is 48 years old and single. She had 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys, 3 of them are married but live with her and she is also in charge of the youngest son who is 16 years old. He is the one in charge of contracting the meat and search for the person that will slaughter the pig. It has a cost of C$100(Nicaraguan currency). Francisca Susana has worked as a janitor at the "Josefa Toledo de Aguerri" National Institute of Chontales for 5 years beginning her labor at 6:00 a.m. and finishing at 3:00 p.m. She has to wake up every day at 4:00 a.m. to fulfill her other responsibility. She works on the pig processing business on Saturdays starting the activity a 3:00 a.m. to deliver the meat starting at 6 a.m. She has been developing this business for 3 years which allows her to have a small income of C$200 (Nicaraguan currency) to cover the family's needs and it also provides some leftover product that the family consumes. The earnings are better when she processes 2 pigs but she generally processes one due to lack of cash. She is asking for her third loan because she wants to expand the market and have better earnings. The loans that she had before have been paid in a responsible manner since she is an honest person.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Francisca Susana, sotera, 48 años de edad, tubo 4 hijos, 2 mujeres, 2 varones, 3 de ellos casados pero conviven con ella, está a su cargo su hijo menor de 16 años, quien es el encargado de contratar la carne y buscar la persona que sacrifica al cerdo, tiene un costo de C$100.Francisca Susana trabaja como conserje en el Instituto Nacional de Chontales "Josefa Toledo de Aguerri" desde hace 5 años iniciando labores a las 6:00 am finalizando a las 3:00 pm teniendo que levantarse todos los días a las 4:00 am para luego cumplir con su otra responsabilidad.Los días que dedica para el destace son los sábados iniciando la actividad a las 3:00 am para entregar la carne a partir de las 6:00 am, tiene 3 años de estar desarrollando este trabajo lo que le permite tener un pequeño ingreso de C$200 para completar los costos familiares, pero además le queda del producto para que la familia coma. La ganancia es mejor cuando mata 2 cerdos, pero generalmente es uno por falta de efectivo.Está solicitando su tercer crédito porque quiere ampliar el mercado y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus créditos anteriores los pagó con responsabilidad, ya que es una persona que se caracteriza por su honestidad y honradez.

loans.use: Investment on the pig processing business.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene owns a restaurant in the 16 de Noviembre neighborhood in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. He and his wife own their own home in the same neighborhood and have two children, both students, who are 16 and 20 years old and help their parents out in the restaurant. The restaurant offers lunch each day and has many regular customers.

There is a lot of competition with other lunch counters, but Rene's prices are very low, which allows him to maintain a loyal customer base. The restaurant also has very high hygienic standards and the food is high quality, so the business is very stable.

Rene and his wife will use this loan to buy more tables and chairs for their restaurant so that they can seat more clients, as well as new dishes and silverware.

The couple has excellent credit history. This is their fourth loan with AgroCapital, and they have never gotten behind on their payments.

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs, dishes and silverware for restuarant

loans.name: Dilovarjon

texts.en:
Dilovarjon O. is 20 years old. He is not married and despite his young age, he runs his own business. He decided to dedicate himself to raising livestock two years ago, after gaining experience working on a livestock ranch. He added everything he learned to the education his parents instilled in him since he was a child. 

Dilovarjon plans to keep raising livestock and to acquire even more. This is why he is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) that would allow him to purchase more food for the normal development and competitiveness of his cattle. He promises to repay the loan in 15 months. He thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Rahmat Ulla

texts.en:
Rahmat Ullah has been living for long time in Khewa, Nangrahar province. He is 27 years old, married, and the father of five children. He is an educated man and a teacher at Khewa Children's School. He is teaching math, geography and history. He is also a good farmer.

Rahmat grows different vegetables on his land, and after that, he brings them to the bazaar for selling. Because his salary is just 4,000AF ($8 US) per month, it is not enough for his whole household. Therefore, he wants to buy some animals and he needs a 50,000AF ($1000 US) individual loan for 27 months. For this, he contacted the lenders of AFSG to give him a 50,000AF individual loan for 27 months so he can buy some animals for his land.

He says, "By selling milk and yogurt, my income will increase and my problems will be solved. Thanks a lot to the lenders of Kiva."

loans.use: To purchase livestock for milk and yogurt production.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy tiene 29 años, vive junto a su conviviente, con quien también trabaja, juntos tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando y son su mayor tesoro. Se dedica a la venta abarrotes, los lleva a vender por los distintos caseríos del río Ucayali, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 2 años, lo que le gusta es que conoce muchos lugares y muchas personas. Le es rentable, ya que cuando lleva estos productos, salen como pan caliente. Lo dificultoso son los viajes, ya que tiene que salir para los caseríos de 3 a 7 días y tiene que dejar a su familia. Ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, por lo que está en el 3er préstamo con MFP. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la construcción de un kiosco en las afueras de su casa, para así tener su negocio estable y estar al pendiente de su familia.
texts.en:
Roy is 29 years old, has a partner with whom he lives and works, and together they have two children who are studying and who are their greatest treasure. He sells groceries, selling them in various farmhouses along the Ucayali river. He has been doing this work for 2 years, and what he enjoys the most is going to many places and meeting many people. The difficult things are the trips themselves, as he has to leave his family for 3 to 7 days. He has demonstrated being punctual in his payments, as this is the third loan with MFP. The money will be used in the construction of a kiosk on the outside of his home, thereby having a stable business and be attentive to the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk to establish his business in a steady locale

loans.name: Karina Virginia

texts.es:
La señorita Karina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Villa del Lago II” del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera sin hijos. Karina con el primer préstamo de S/ 500 compró productos de belleza de unique para vender. Tiene casi 4 año trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que estudia nutrición en la universidad.
Con este préstamo de S/.2500 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza de Unique.
Karina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a ser directora de su empresa de productos de belleza y montar un restaurante de comida andina nutritiva.
texts.en:
Señorita Karina is a member of the community bank “Women from the Village on the Lake II” from the neighbourhood Puno, in Puno Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 25 years old and is single with no children. With her first loan of S/500, Karina purchased Unique beauty products to sell. She has worked with the bank for almost 4 years. She tells us that she studies nutrition in the university. With this loan of S/.2500 that she would repay in 4 installments, she would buy a larger quantity of Unique beauty products. Karina wants to continue working in order to become a director of her business of beauty products and to start a restaurant of nutritious Andean food.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is a 44 year old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three children and two of them attend school. Akosua lives at Abuakwa, a suburb of Kumasi in the Ashanti region. She has lived there since she started her local restaurant. Akosua husband is very supportive in providing the basic needs of the family.   

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared by pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soups. Banku is prepared from milled maize grain and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, she has attracted lots of customers in the area she serves. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional employees to assist her in food delivering service. 

Akosua says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to  meet her operating expenses. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.
 
Akosua belongs to a village bank called Regina. She hope to receive a loan of GH¢500 to make business expand by increasing her inventory. This would enable her save more to support the husband with taking care of the Children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom B. is a young married man and the father of two children. He travels to the different flea markets in the region in search of cattle to purchase, which he then sells at the “Vahdat” market and also sells them wholesale to butchers. Bahrom now needs a loan of 2000 Somoni, which he plans to use to purchase more cattle. His dreams are to improve his business, establish his own wealth, and improve his home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for his business

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni C. is currently in the business of selling books at a bookshop and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Poni is 22 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 2 children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her book-selling business

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: S. akoko  exerce depuis 1979 le commerce de « kluklu » qui est une sorte de galette faite à base de maïs et d’huile, cette galette est très appréciée au Togo surtout dans la partie septentrionale du Togo, son stock de maïs nécessaires à la fabrication de cette galette est épuisé, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 06 sacs de maïs et 04 bidons d’huile. Elle est mariée avec un militaire qui est à la retraite, ils ont 07 personnes à leurs charges et avec le bénéfice de son commerce elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer
texts.en:
Since 1979, S. Akoko has been making and selling "kluklu", a galette made out of corn and oil and very much appreciated in Togo, especially in the South. She's out of stock of corn, which is why she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, to buy 6 sacks of corn and 4 cans of oil. She's married to a retired soldier, and they have 7 children to support. With the profits of her business, she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 sacks of corn and 4 cans of oil

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 40 years old and is married with three children.  She sells foodstuffs.  She hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Гулбахор Муминова торгует на вещевом рынке города Истаравшана. В ассортимент ее товара входят различная женская и детская обувь. Стаж ее деятельности 3 года. Хочет получить займ в размере 4500 сомони, и планирует потратить его для реализации и оборота своего товара.
   Гулбахор замужем, у нее 3 детей. Торговля обувью приносит достаточную прибыль, для того чтобы удовлетворить свои нужды и потребности ее семьи.
texts.en:
Gulbahor M. trades at the clothing market in the city of Istaravshan. Her range of products includes women's and children's shoes. She has three years of experience in this line of work, and wants to take out a loan in the amount of 4500 somoni, which she plans to spend on the purchase of goods and to increase turnover. Gulbahor is married, and she has three children. Selling shoes brings in enough profit to meet her needs and those of her family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing inventory and increasing turnover

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace H. is 33 years old and a mother of three children. They live in Canitoan, Baungon, Bukidnon. Her husband farms cassava and corn as their primary products. Since farming is seasonal and Mary wants to earn a daily income, she engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business to support the needs of the family. She wants it to expand and needs additional money to procure additional stock for the variety store. She is now applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Mary is hoping for a positive response to her request.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase addtional items for the variety store

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at K., age fifty-one, and her husband Mr. Sophai Orn, age fifty-two, were married in 1975. They have five daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home. Two other daughters weave silk at home, and the youngest studies in the local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city.

Sam-at’s husband has been a fisherman for ten years. He fishes from a lake and river near his village. Their main income comes from her daughters' silk-weaving business. They don’t have enough capital to purchase silk materials to continue their business, so Sam-at is requesting her first loan to provide financial help to her daughters.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her daughters' weaving business.

loans.name: Unidas Para Seguir 3 Group

texts.en:
Dolores D. L. R. (middle) is the coordinator of her group of five women named Unidas Para Seguir.  In a house just outsiD. of Samaná, Dominican Republic, Dolores lives with her three children, ages 19, 16, and 14.  Dolores is currently on her first loan, making charcoal, which she sells to others in her neighborhood.  

While this may be her first loan with Esperanza, Dolores has been selling charcoal now for several years.  Many people in the neighborhood depend on this charcoal for cooking and other uses.  She makes her charcoal in a clearing in the trees which line one of the streets in the neighborhood.

Dolores took out the loan in the hopes that it would help her business continue to grow.  She sees this as a great opportunity to expand her production, and is seeking to support her children’s career goals with the additional funds.  Two of her children want to be a doctor and a lawyer, and Dolores would love to be able to support them long enough for them to study in a nearby university.  This loan has become an opportunity to invest in her children’s education and career aspirations.

loans.use: buying new equipment, sacks, and other goods to expand her charcoal production

loans.name: Ziyodabu

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Зиёдабу женщина - 41 лет. Замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем и сыновьями. Зиёдабу откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Зиёдабу продают их на скотном рынке. Зиёдабу кредитуется в нашей организации впервые. Она хочет взять займ для приобретения скота. Зиёдабу планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Зиёдабу очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Ziyodabu is a 41 year old woman. She is married and has four children. She feeds and sells cattle together with her husband and sons. Ziyodabo feeds the cattle at home and when it is ready her sons sells it on the cattle market. Ziyodabu is receiving a loan from our organization for the first time. She wants to take a loan to buy cattle. Ziyodabu plans to increase the number of cattle and this way increase the income for her family. Ziyodabu likes the loan terms very much and she is happy that organization such as this one exist and support the society.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
El Banco El Paraíso se encuentra ubicado en el centro D. Huancavelica.

Adriana tiene 02 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, negocio que fue creciendo gracias a su dedicación.  Ella, con la ayuda D. sus créditos quiere mejorar  su tienda y comprar mas mercadería, lo que le generara mas ganancias y así poder ahorrar más, para la construcción D. su casa.

Valentina tiene 03 hijos. Ella inicio un negocio D. venta D. productos variados con su esposo, gracias a los créditos obtenidos el negocio fue mejorando. Con su próximo préstamo comprara mas mercadería en la capital. Actualmente se encuentra ahorrando, ya que tiene dentro D. sus planes, llegar a construir su casa.

Julia es viuda y tiene 01 hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. carne y los días D. feria,  venD. prendas interiores. Ella quiere comprar animales para la venta D. su carne y con las ganancias generadas por estas, comprar mas prendas D. vestir, D. esta manera seguir haciendo crecer sus negocios y llegar a tener un puesto fijo para sus ventas.
texts.en:
“Paradise” Communal Bank is located in downtown Huancavelica. Adriana has 2 children, she sells basic needs products, a business that has grown thanks to her dedication. With the help of her loans she wants to improve her store and buy more merchandise, which will result in greater earnings and in this way she will be able to save more in order to build her house. Valentina has 3 children. She began a business selling a variety of products with her husband. Thanks to the loans she has received her business has been improving. With her next loan she will buy more merchandise in the capital city. Today she is saving, because she has plans to build a house. Julia is a widow and has 1 child. She sells meat and on holidays she sells under garments. She wants to buy animals to sell for their meat and with the earnings buy more clothing items. In this way she will continue growing her business and be able to have a fixed locale for her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their respective businesses

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila A. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Leonila is married and has four grown children. To make a living, Leonila owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Leonila has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $104) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Leonila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mamary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamary C. est un célibataire de 30 ans qui vit chez ses parents dans une grande famille polygame dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Après les études secondaires avec comme spécialité la comptabilité, il est resté pendant des années sans emploi. Il a tenté plusieurs activités sans réussite et finit par décider de s’installer dans l’aviculture qu’il a appris auprès de son ami.
Avec une expérience de 2 ans  il maîtrise bien son activité. 
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, Monsieur Mamary C. décide de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter de la nourriture, des médicaments et des poussins pour préparer la relève des sujets en voie de vieillissement. Il est à son premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Les œufs son vendus, au comptant, en détail et souvent en gros, au marché , à la maison à une clientèle de large gamme constituée de  propriétaires de boutiques, d’alimentations et de  restaurants sans oublier quelques consommateurs. 
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Mamary C. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 64 500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.

loans.use: Achat de nourritures, médicaments et poussins.

loans.name: Humura Nyakasanja United Muziguzi Perisi Group

texts.en: M. Perisi is the group President of Humura Nyakasanja United; she is thirty-nine years old single woman with four children of which three are going to school. She has one dependent schooling too. She deals with retail shop and also she is a tailor. She is using the loan to purchase essential items mostly that is sugar, rice, soap, salt, etc in her shop. She wants to add stock to improve upon her business. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase essential items mostly that is sugar, rice, soap, salt, etc in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire help for the harbest and to purchase fertilisers.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their children in a small community in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She has sold kenkey with fried fish for four years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Allah Bekwaana Group

texts.en: Asanatu is forty two years old. She is married and has given birth to one girl. Her daughter is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Asanatu is a food vendor. She sells porridge. Asanatu is the leader of a trust bank group called Allah Bekwaana. Most of the group members are either into trading and farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Asanatu, the group leader is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food preparation business

loans.name: Esperanza De Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed through the initiative of Blanca E., who heard of the program and decided to join with 22 other humble workingwomen who must earn their daily livelihood.
The group members are independent in their work. Some work as street vendors selling clothes, others own pantries where they sell food, still others sell silver jewelry from street stalls or have gardens and sell their products in the local market. They will receive an average credit of 450,000 PYG each, which they will invest in their businesses, buying sugar, flour, eggs, noodles, meat (pork, beef, chicken), cassava, soft drinks, candy, vegetable seeds, and clothes such as jeans, shirts, skirts, lingerie, silver jewelry, etc.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming inputs

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes A. is from the village of Polo. She is 52 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Mercedes owns and operates a business making and selling nipa hut products to local businesses and community members (a nipa hut is a native house constructed out of bamboo with a thatched roof made from the leaves of the Nipa palm). She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Mercedes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,500 PHP from PMPC. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to make nipa hut products and to use as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials  and to use as working capital

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn Y. is 47 years old and lives in Sambour village in the Takeo province. She is a group leader of five people who will all use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokhorn Y. and her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Thuch, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this farm, Mrs. Sokhorn Y. now faces a small problem because her field has a lot of insects; thus, she is requesting a loan to buy pesticides to kill all the insects. She will use the rest of the loan to buy gasoline for her watering machine. This couple has a child who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and to buy gasoline for her watering machine

loans.name: Apayi

texts.en:
Apayi S. is currently in the business of selling various items, such as biscuits and sweets, and is requesting a loan to stock bags of sugar, salt, and other items.

Apayi is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a mechanic. She has one child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of sugar, salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Audelia Patricia

texts.es:
la sra. Audelia Patricia F. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Barrio los Fuertes en la ciudad de Choluteca.
Audelia se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, tiene un local y tambien sale a vender a diferentes comunidades cercanas a la ciudad de Choluteca.
todos los dias se tiene que levantar temprano para atender a su familia para luego empezar a vender su ropa.
ahora ya tiene un local en el cual tiene su ropa bien ordenada y tambien tiene espacio para poder almacenar la ropa que compra y que no se vende.
dice sentirse muy contenta ya que todo le esta saliendo muy bien.
necesita el credito para comprar mas fardos de ropa y asi tener mejores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia que es lo mas importante para ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Audelia Patricia F. is 41 years old and lives in the los Fuertes neighborhood in the city of Choluteca. Audelia sells second hand clothing and has a stall; she also goes out to sell to different neighborhoods close to the city of Choluteca.

Everyday she has to wake up early to take care of her family and then goes out to sell her clothing.

Now, Audelia has a small store, where she has her clothing organized and has space to store the clothing that she buys and has not sold.

She says that she is very happy since everything is going very well.

Mrs. F. needs a loan to buy more bags of clothing so that she will be able to have more earnings which she needs to give her family a better quality of life since this is the most important thing for her.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of clothing.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus hijas en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijas la llevó hace trece años a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y verduras en el mercado El Hueco, de la ciudad de Paiján. Durante estos años ha dado todo de si para que el negocio salga adelante y ahora su negocio goza de una clientela fiel que siempre acude a el para agenciarse de verduras y abarrotes. María no descansa y siempre trata de seguir avanzando para salir adelante junto a sus hijas.

Es siguiendo su objetivo de crecimiento que desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más variedad de verduras y abarrotes con los cuales pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer alegre y muy entregada a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijas la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera que les asegure un futuro prometedor. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and a single mother. She lives with her daughters in the “Paiján” district of the “Ascope” province in the “La Libertad” region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Her desire to help her daughters get ahead motivated her to begin selling groceries and vegetables in the “El Hueco” market, in the city of Paiján three years ago. During that time she has given her all to make the business a success, and now it boasts a faithful clientele that regularly goes to her to buy vegetables and groceries. María never rests and always tries to progress so that she can get ahead with her daughters. She wants to grow her business by buying a greater variety of vegetables and groceries to satisfy her customers’ needs, so she finds herself requesting a 2,000 PEN ($700) loan through Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her objective. María is a happy woman very bound to her work. Her greatest desire is to be able to provide her daughters with the opportunity to study and achieve a career that will provide them a promising future. She has worked with our institution in the past and has proven herself to be a responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Groceries and vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina C. V. tiene 49 años y estuvo casada por más de 20 años pero su esposo la abandono y ahora vive sola. Tiene 2 hijos para los cuales saco un préstamo para poder comprarles un equipo de soldadura y así puedan trabajar. La señora Delfina vive en la comunidad de Maica Sud en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 vacas, cuya leche utiliza para elaborar queso y venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba y a las vendedoras de Charque (un plato tradicional de Cochabamba que se come acompañado con queso). La señora Delfina se dedica a elaborar queso hace más de 32 años.

Con el crédito otorgado por kiva el año pasado la señora Delfina pudo comprar alimento para su ganado lechero (Challa) que por problemas de sequia el costo de la misma subió mucho y no le alcanzaba para comprar todo el alimento que sus vacas necesitaban. De este modo no tuvo problemas de seguir produciendo la misma cantidad de leche que ya produce y la cantidad de queso. La señora Delfina espera poder obtener este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar una vaca lechera y aumentar su producción de leche y así sus ingresos, y agradece mucho a la gente que por medio se kiva confió en ella y le dio la oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en:
Delfina C. V. is forty-nine and was married for more than twenty years, but her husband left her, so now she lives by herself. She has two children, for whom took out a loan to buy welding equipment so they could work. She lives in the Maica Sud community in Cochabamba. She has three cows, and uses their milk to make cheese, which she sells in the different markets in the city of Cochabamba as well as to the people who sell Charque (a traditional Cochababma dish, eaten with cheese). Delfina has been making cheese for more than thirty-two years. With the loan she received through Kiva last year, Delfina was able to buy food (corn husks) for her milk cows. Due to drought, prices increased significantly and she wasn't able to buy all the food her cows needed. With the loan, she had no problem continuing to produce the same amount of milk and, accordingly, cheese. Delfina hopes she'll be able to get this loan to buy a milk cow so she can increase milk production and with it her income. She really appreciates the people who, through Kiva, have put their trust in her and given her the opportunity to better herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Toychieva Mohidilhon`s Group

texts.ru:
Тойчиева Мохидилхон является лидером этой группы. В этой группе собрались 4 участника, которые хотят, чтобы их жизнь стала лучше, и они надеятся друг на друга.  Лидер группы занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно выращиванием кукурузы, риса. Кредит запрашивается для закупа семян хлопчатника и удобрения.  У Мохидилхон 3 детей. Старшие двое учатся в школе. Супруг работает сварщиком на дому, в основном изготавливает металлические ворота.

Мехринисо, 29, замужем. У нее двое детей дошкольного возраста. Супруг работает строителем в Бишкеке. Вместе с свекровкой она занимается сельским хозяйством. В этом году планируют посеять хлопок, кредит нужен для закуп семян. 

Ахмаджану 61 год. Он пенсионер, и все свое свободное время занимается домашним хозяйством. А его супруга занимается предоставлением услуг пошива на заказ женских одежд и национальных изделий в месяц зарабатывает около 75 долларов.На кредит планирует закупить семена хлопчатника, и минеральные удобрения.

Тавакилхон, 58, замужем. Супруг уехал на заработки в РФ, там работает электриком. Клиент в данное время пенсионер, до пенсия работала акушеркой в районной больнице. В данное время она занимается животноводством окормом и разведением коров. На кредит  клиентка планирует закупить на 15К две телки, и на остальную сумму семена хлопчатника и минеральное удобрение  и расходовать на ГСМ.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Mohidilhon T. is the leader of this group. The group consists of 4 participants, who wish that their lives become better and reply on each other. The group leader is involved in agriculture, specifically, in growing corn and rice. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of cotton seeds and fertilizers. Mohidilhon has 3 children. The oldest two go to school. Her husband works as a welder at home and primarily makes metal gates. Mehriniso is 29 years old, married. She has two children of pre-school age. Her husband is a construction worker in Bishkek. Mehriniso and her mother-in-law are involved in agriculture. This year, they plan to plant cotton and need the loan to buy seeds. Ahmadjan is 61 years old. He is retired and spends all of his free time taking care of the household business. And his wife is involved in providing sewing services and makes-to-order women’s clothing and national goods. She earns about 75 dollars per month. Ahmadjon plans to use the loan for the purchase of cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers. Tavakilhon is 58 years old, married. Her husband left to work in the Russian Federation, where he works as an electrician. The client is currently retires and worked as a midwife at the district hospital. She is currently involved in animal husbandry – fattening and breeding cattle. The client plans to use 15k of the loan to buy two cows and use the rest of the sum to buy cotton seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cotton seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en una casa heredada por sus padres. Desde hace un año, se ha dedicado en la venta de edredones y cubrecamas en ferias comerciales, este comercio lo hace de manera ambulante. En algunas ocasiones su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan en esta labor, otras veces su ventas lo realiza, ofreciendo a sus amistades y vecinos, dejando a crédito la mercadería. Este negocio le ha permitido a Jenny percibir ganancias, que le ayudaron a establecer su economía y mantener estable su negocio. Sus planes será incrementar su capital y vender otros artículos más para el hogar. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, además fue invitada a formar parte de su grupo comunal, porque la conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más edredones y cubrecamas al por mayor, para tener mayor variedad de productos y ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jenny, 37, lives with her husband and 4 children in a house she inherited from her parents. For the last year she has sold comforters and bedspreads in markets; she does not have a fixed sales point. Sometimes her husband and children help her with her work and on other occasions she sells to her friends and neighbors, leaving the merchandise on credit. The business has produced profits for Jenny that have helped her maintain her family’s and her business’s economic stability. Her plans are to increase her capital to sell more home products. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to join her communal group because she is known to be a responsible and hard-working person. She will use the requested funds to buy more comforters and bedspreads at wholesale in order to have more varied stock to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more comforters and bedspreads.

loans.name: Nidia Amarilis

texts.es: Nidia Amarilis P. V. de 27 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella es una joven la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que siempre esta dispuesta a hacer algo más por el bienestar de sus dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad, así mismo para solventar los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo. Nidia comercializa ropa para mujeres y hombre, calzado y cosméticos, los cuales vende de forma ambulante ya que de esta manera ella puede vender más productos. Así mismo cuando sus ventas son muy pocas, ella trabaja haciendo los quehaceres del hogar en diferentes casas, ya que esto le permite obtener algo de ganancias extras, de esta manera ella puede obtener más dinero para invertir en la ropa y los cosméticos, lo que en muchas ocasiones no da a basto. Nidia solicita  un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más cosméticos en diferentes marcas y precios y así mismo más ropa y zapatos, de manera que las ganancias que obtiene haciendo oficio ajeno puedan ser por completo para el sustento de sus dos pequeños.
texts.en:
Nidia Amarilis is 27 years old and resides in the municipality of San Martín, located in the department of San Salvador. She is a young person who can count on very good references from her neighbors. She is always disposed to do something more for the wellbeing of her 2 children of 10 and 5 years of age, and also to contribute along side her husband, to household income. Nidia sells women's and men's clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, in the streets, since she can sell more products that way. Also, when her sales are few, she does housework in different homes, since this permits her to contribute extra income. In this way, she can obtain more money to invest in clothing and cosmetics which on many occasions, she doesn't have enough of. Nidia is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics of different brands and prices and, also, more clothing and shoes, so that her working earnings may be adequate for sustaining her two little ones.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTHING, COSMETICS, AND SHOES TO SELL

loans.name: Zorayda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Zorayda es madre de familia de dos hijos estudiantes, para ella no ha sido fácil ya que es madre soltera, a muchos esfuerzos ha logrado hacer su casa, con  financiamiento ya que solo a través de estos prestamos se le hace posible por los plazos. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y comida. En medio tiempo ya que trabaja como farmacéutica también para poder obtener otros ingresos y poder cubrir sus gastos Ya que todo esta caro. 

Con este préstamo invertirá en comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y lograr un anexo a su vivienda. Sus planes son a largo plazo ya que aun le falta repellar, poner piso, pintar que espera lograr para gozar de las mejoras.
texts.en:
Señora Zorayda is the mother of two school-aged children. Life hasn’t been easy for her as a single mother, and she has had to work hard to build a home. It was only made possible through loans that she paid back in installments. Zorayda sells food and cosmetics. She also works as a pharmacist in order to earn more money to cover her expenses since everything is so expensive. With this loan she will buy stones, sand, cement, and metal rods to add another room to her house. Her plans are longterm as the plastering, flooring, and painting still remain to be done, but she hopes one day to enjoy these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials and add a room to her house

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa A., 42, is married to a soldier and they have four children, all attending school. Currently in the business of selling beads and necklaces at the market. she is requesting a loan to stock packets of beads to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Santa hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock packets of beads to sell

loans.name: Rovena

texts.en:
Rovena L. is from the village of  Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old. Rovena is married and has 3 school-aged children.
