To make a living, Rovena owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Rovena has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rovena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rovena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rovena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure two dairy cows.

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Gereltuya N. lives with her son and parents in their own apartment in Baganuur, an outskirt district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She operates a consumer goods and clothing retailing business. She began her business in 2005 at a trading stall. 

Gereltuya sells a variety of women's clothing and her products are well-known for their quality and design. She is the kind of person who is hardworking and modest and wants to increase her business revenues. 

Gereltuya is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase more clothing in Beijing, China, at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
Ayush C. is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 22 and 25, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two daughters help Ayush with her sewing business, while her husband is handicapped and stays at home. 

Ayush operates a business of sewing traditional Mongolian clothes, such as deels (long coats), as well as making cotton cases for mugs, caps and snuff bottles. She began her business in 2008 and has since become established in the local business community. 

Ayush supplies her embroidered products to shops where the items can be sold to tourists. She hopes to become even more successful so that she can provide for her family in the future.

Her family is building a house in their yard and she hopes to one day open her own small tailoring shop. Ayush is a hardworking woman who is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan so that she can purchase more fabric and materials and a sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric and materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags and lappas (a traditional dress for woman) to sell.

loans.name: Salina Chepkemboi

texts.en:
Salina Chepkemboi R. is a 40-year-old lady married to Paul Kipngetich Katam. They have six children, ages 22, 18, 16, 14, 11 and 5 years old. They live in Kipchamo outside of Eldoret town. Salina has a general store where she earns her income. She has been in this business for the past five years with an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. She will use her profit to improve their standard of living.

Chepkemboi was introduced to KADET by a friend. She is applying for her third loan of 27,900 KES with KADET after paying her previous loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to buy three bags of sugar, four boxes of cooking oil and three boxes of bathing soap. She hopes to operate wholesale in town and to have a stable source of income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil and bathing soap

loans.name: Kory Chuyma Group

texts.es:
“KORY CHUYMAS” es el nombre de la asociación comunal que está por iniciar su noveno ciclo en el centro focal Santiago II. Su nombre es de origen Aymara, idioma propio del área andina y quiere decir “Corazón de Oro”. Integran esta asociación catorce mujeres.

La presidenta es la señora Remedios, ella ya trabaja dos años con Pro Mujer, su negocio es la venta de mandiles.  Los mandiles son elaborados por ella misma y los vende en diferentes ferias, los días miércoles y jueves de 9:30 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.
Su negocio ha crecido, comenta que su primer crédito fue de Bs. 1000.-, y que actualmente ha solicitado Bs.5500.-, este dinero ha sido y será utilizado para la compra de tela.   Aprendió este negocio de una amiga hace 20 años.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa de bebé, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de ropa,  venta de cosméticos, puesto de fruta, pintura en tela, tejido de tapetes, confección de manteles, venta de ropa, cafetería, venta de salchipapas, venta de pasankalla.
texts.en:
"Kory Chuymas" is the name of the community association that is about to start its ninth cycle in the Santiago II center. Their name has origins in Aymara, a native language of the Andean area and means "Heart of Gold." 14 women are members of this association. The president is Mrs. Remedios. She has worked for two years with "Pro Mujer". Her business is selling aprons. The aprons are made by her and she sells them in different markets on Wednesdays and Thursdays from 9:30 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. Her business has grown. She notes that her first loan was for Bs. 1000 and currently she is requesting Bs. 5500. This money has been and will be used to purchase fabric. She learned this business from a friend twenty years ago. With respect to the businesses in the association, they are varied. Among them we have: selling baby clothing, neighborhood shop, selling food, selling clothing, selling cosmetics, a fruit stand, painted fabric, woven rugs, making tablecloths, a cafeteria, selling salchipapas (hot dogs), selling pasankalla (a sweet dish).

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Jackielou

texts.en:
Jackielou I. is from the village of Natappian West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 25 years old. Jackielou is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jackielou owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jackielou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised pig.

Jackielou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jackielou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. Jackielou is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jackielou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Glenda Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

La señora Glenda es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta por eso. Además se desempeña como la tesorera del Banco función que cumple de muy buena forma, le gusta el banco por el cumplimiento de las socias y de la institución. Ella tiene 24 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 3 años. Estudia el octavo semestre en Ing. Finanzas en la Universidad San Gregorio de Portoviejo. Su marido es comerciante.

Se dedica a la venta de tarjetas y recargas telefónicas, tiene un local en su casa donde además de cuidar a sus hijos y su hogar también  genera sus propios ingresos que le ayudan en sus gastos de los estudios. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 16h00 ya que en las noches estudia.

Este crédito es para comprar las tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera para ser una profesional y poder conseguir un trabajo acorde a su especialidad.
texts.en:
The members of the Ilusiones Communal Bank meet every fifteen days in the residential community of El Progreso in Portoviejo, a heavily populated marginal urban area.  It is known as the prison sector because the Portoviejo women’s prison is located here.

Glenda is very happy to be a member of the communal bank.  She is also the treasurer of the bank, a job which she performs very well.  She is pleased with the performance of the members and the institution.

She is 24 years old.  She is in a common-law relationship and has two children who are 4 and 3 years old.  She is studying Financial Engineering and is in her eighth semester at the Universidad San Gregorio de Portoviejo.  Her husband is a shopkeeper.

She sells rechargeable phone cards.  She runs her business from home where, in addition to caring for her children and her home, she generates her own income which helps pay her tuition.  She works every day from 7:00 AM until 6:00 PM and studies in the evenings.  

She will use this loan to buy rechargeable phone cards.   She dreams of completing her degree and obtaining a professional position in her area of specialization.

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards.

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es: Maritza Guadalupe P. B. de 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos de 8 y 18 años de edad, por quienes trabaja muy duro para brindarles todo lo necesario para vivir bien. Maritza posee un comedor, el cual esta ubicado en la Escuela Católica de San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad, mismo departamento en el cual vive junto a su familia. Ella ha trabajado durante muchos años haciendo desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa golosinas, bebidas, fruta y otros más. Maritza necesita poder incrementar su materia prima para poder atender a más clientes, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras, granos básicos, fruta, jugos, sodas, todo lo necesario para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y así mismo atender a más clientes. Ella desea mucho poder aprovechar al máximo esta situación, debido a que es la única forma en la cual se gana la vida, y la cual le ha permitido poder sostener a sus hijos durante mucho tiempo, ya que ella es madre soltera, y es la única que vela por el bienestar de su hogar y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza Guadalupe P. B. is 37 years old.  She lives together with her two children who are 8 and 18 years old.  She works very hard for them in order to provide everything they need to live well.  Maritza owns an eatery which is located in the Catholic School of San Juan Opico, in the department of La Libertad, the same department in which she lives together with her family.  She has worked for many years making breakfasts and lunches.  She also sells candies, drinks, fruit, etc.

Maritza needs to be able to increase her supplies in order to be able to serve more customers.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  She will use it to buy more vegetables, basic grains, fruit, juice, soda and everything she needs to be able to better serve her customers and at the same time serve more customers.  She would very much like to be able to take maximum advantage of this situation since it is the only way in which she earns her living and it has enabled her to support her children for a long time.  She is a single mother and she is the only one who watches out for the well-being of her home and her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making food

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Las señoras que componen este comité son muy sacrificadas, trabajan arduamente en sus respectivos negocios y con el esfuerzo diario sacan adelante a sus familias.

Las Señoras hoy en día cuentan con un pequeño capital para poder aumentar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

Ellas están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguay por tan importante apoyo que les está brindando.
Las Señoras del presente comité son del Barrio San Blas, hoy están en el Ciclo Número 2º programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras con una antigüedad aproximada de 5 meses.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rossana quien se dedica a la venta de lencería.
La manera en que ella trabaja es la de ofrecer sus productos mediante visitas hasta sus clientas, este trabajo lo realiza en sus horas libres, y comenta que le gusta mucho ya que le deja buena ganancia.
Quiere continuar hasta llegar a abrir su propias tienda en su casa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de lencerías  ya que para la temporada de mucha se acerca.
texts.en:
The ladies who make up this committee are very self-sacrificing.  They work hard in their respective businesses and, through the hard work they do every day, they get their families ahead in life.

These days the ladies have a little capital with which they can increase their incomes and their quality of life.

They are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the important support which they have given them.

These ladies are from San Blas neighborhood.  They are currently in their 2nd loan cycle in the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program.  They have been together for approximately five months.

One of the members is Rossana who sells lingerie.  She visits her customers and offers them products.  She carries out her work in her free time and she tells us that she likes it a lot because it makes her good profits.  She would like to keep going until she can open her own store in her home.  She is requesting this loan to buy underwear as a key sales season is approaching.

loans.use: To buy lingerie

loans.name: Yhonny

texts.es:
El señor Yhonni vive en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; esta casado y tiene un hijo; es dueño de un auto con el cual trabaja todos los días en transporte libre de pasajeros, con el cual genera sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar un motor y mantener estable su herramienta de trabajo.

Por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Yhonni lives in La Paz’s San Martín zone.  He’s married and has a son.  He owns a vehicle that he works with daily providing public transportation services which is his source of income to support his family.

He will use the requested loan to buy a motor to keep his work tool in good working order.

His socioeconomic profile qualifies him for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a motor for his taxi.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been dedicating herself to developing her frozen foods business in order to support her dream of improving her family's quality of life. She will be very responsible with her obligations and she is thankful to the people who will support the loan she is requesting. This loan will be very helpful in making her business grow further so that her two children can fulfill their dreams of getting college degrees and finding great jobs.

Maria continues to runs her business to generate income and to financially support her family. She would like to increase her weekly income. For this drive, she applied for a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more stocks of frozen foods and increase her working capital. Maria has already had previous loans from ASHI and repaid them successfully. Therefore, she is being trusted with a much larger loan.
 
As active businesswoman, Maria would also like to explore more business opportunities for herself in the future, in order to proviD. her family a good living. Through business success, Maria would also like to invest in their home. 

She is very pleased to be a Kiva borrower and says "thank you" for helping fund her business dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of frozen foods and increase her working capital

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila P. is 38 years old, married and has one child. She is from the village of Poblacion on the island of Mindanao. To make a living, Mila dries and sells fish. She also receives a salary as a public school teacher.

Mila has been engaged in her dried fish business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Mila is requesting a new loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 20,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Jocelyn is married and has eight adult children. 

To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members; they are located in Preaek Chhmouh village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Mom S. was born in 1966 and has been chosen the group leader.  She was selected as the group leader by the other members.  She and her husband, Mr. Y Von, are farmers who own 3-hectares of land which they use to cultivate rice that they sell to support their family.  Aside from farming, they also earn a living by renting big speakers to those who have a party such as a wedding or birthday party.  In order to support the big speaker business, Mrs. Mom S. would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy more big speakers for rent. 

This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To add her saving to buy more big speakers for rent.

loans.name: Ryhmna

texts.en:
Ryhmna R.  is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old. Ryhmna is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ryhmna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Ryhmna has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ryhmna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryhmna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business.  Ryhmna is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ryhmna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, la socia es casada,  y tiene 3 hijos (17,10,9 años de edad); la socia se dedica a l comercio minorista, ella cría animales menores (cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral); la socia cada cierto tiempo realiza viajes a la provincia de Abancay en Apurimac, ella lleva los cuyes y los pollos para la venta, allá la socia tiene sus clientes que la esperan para comprarle al por mayor los pollos y cuyes, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cuyes y pollos. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de cuyes y pollos para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María, 36, is a member of the “ALLIN MUJU” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children (ages: 17, 10 and 9).  She is a Retailer.  She raises small farm animals (guinea pigs, pigs and barnyard fowl). Every so often she travels to Abancay province in Apurimac and takes guinea pigs and chickens to sell.  She has customers there who wait for her to buy chickens and guinea pigs from her at wholesale.  She wants to use the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.  She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens to sell.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Dom

texts.en:
Mr. Dom D. is 32 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Chanda Yon, is also 32 years old (pictured together). They live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2000 and have two sons. One is in school and another one is still young. 

Dom is a chef. He cooks for a restaurant in Phnom Penh. His wife is a tailor. In addition, the couple also grows lotus. They hire their fellow villagers to grow lotus. Dom is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his lotus farm and to pay for planting fees.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his lotus farm and to pay for planting fees.

loans.name: Gerardo Wilfredo

texts.es: EL SEÑOR C. LABORA COMO TECNICO EN REFRIGERACION Y AIRE ACONDICIONADO ,ES SOLTERO ,TIENE  SEIS PERSONAS A SU CARGO, ES  EL PRIMER  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE HAN BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA  COMPRAR CEMENTO, BLOQUE, HIERRO, MANO DE OBRA,CINZ , PERLIN PARA HACER ANEXO CUARTO  Y COCINA EN SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Mr. C. works as a refrigeration and air conditioning technician. He is single and in charge of six people.

This is his first loan from Ceprodel and he is grateful for the opportunity given by the institution. The loan is needed to buy cement, iron, zinc and to pay for labor to build a room and kitchen in his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. W. is 36 years old and married to Margaret, who is a house wife.  They have one child, who is two years old.  David has been supplying charcoal in Mwiki town for 11 years and earns an income of KES.25,300 monthly.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to hire a bigger truck so that he can supply charcoal to distant places, e.g, Kitui.  The anticipated income will be used to improve the living standards of his family.

In the future, he plans to buy his own truck so that he can be responsible for fuel only and not for a rental.

loans.use: to hire a truck that can transport 150 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 52 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Nena has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 26 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Nena aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en:
Felicite is 35 years old. She has 2 children who are 6 and 9 years old. They are both in school. 

Felicite has been selling fruit for 10 years. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her children. It has also enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more fruit in order to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Salamata

texts.fr:
Mme Salamata est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26 ans et le moins âgé a 19 ans. Tous vont à l’école et elle a 8 personnes a sa charge.

 Elle vend des choux et des aubergines depuis 26 ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de larlé en ville et à bobo dioulasso capital économique du burkina.Ses clients sont les revendeurs(les détaillants)
.
Elle veut s’acheter 5 sacs de choux et 6 sacs d’aubergines.

Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants et les soigner en cas de maladie. Elle ambitionne payer une parcelle et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Salamata is a widow with 4 children between 19 and 26 who all attend school; she also has another 8 children in her care. 
She has sold cabbages and aubergines for 26 years. She sources her goods from the Iarlé town market and from Bobo Dioulasso, the economic capital of Burkina Faso. Her customers are retailers. 
She would like to purchase 5 bags of cabbages and 6 bags of aubergines. 
She would like to use the profits from her business to pay for her children's education and pay for healthcare should they need it. Her aim is to buy a plot of land and boost her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages and aubergines

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teofila; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carne y leche, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en las distintas ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carne y leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne y leche al por mayor.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the "Richary Anteña" community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Teofila is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling meat and milk.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in the street markets in Anta province.  She works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Teofila would like to expand her business selling meat and milk.  She is requesting this loan to buy meat and milk wholesale.

Teofila is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy meat and milk wholesale

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Myrna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy beverages, canned goods and snacks.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods and snacks for resale.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Console is a 52-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of 19 and 23.  One child has finished primary school and the other two are still completing their studies. Her husband works as a farmer.

For the past 30 years, she has sold a local drink called urbushera, which is made from sorghum. This successful business has enabled her to feed her children and improve her family’s standard of living. 

She will use this loan to purchase more sorghum from which she will make more urbushera.

She hopes to earn enough profits to purchase a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian, 47, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Edwin, a businessman, and a father to her three children. Her eldest child is in college and the youngest is in elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating a business. 

Vivian operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Vivian earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vivian hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Salima

texts.fr:
Salima est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée à un transporteur. Elle a trois (3) enfants. 
Salima travaille comme revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2000. Elle achète et revend ses produits pour sa clientèle composée de toute personne. Elle exerce son activité à agoè Zongo. Elle  achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. 
Salima a requis son 2ème crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des conserves, des pâtes alimentaires, des cartons de savons et autres.
texts.en: Salima is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a truck driver and has 3 children. She has been selling groceries to a wide range of customers in Agoè Zongo since 2000. She gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market. Salima is asking for a second loan from WAGES in order to restock her inventory with goods including canned foods, pasta and cartons of soap.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Miryan Isidra

texts.es:
Miryan de 37 años hace 3 años recibió un bono, el cual lo aprovechó y quiso administrar su propio negocio, una despensa en donde tiene de todo un poco en lo que a viveres se refiere.
Aqui ella se siente muy productiva para poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos y que son excelentes estudiantes en escuelas fiscales. 

Ella se levanta muy temprano envia a sus niños a estudiar y continua con la atención de la despensa. No ha tenido problemas en el sector para desempeñar su labor. Al momento ella desea gestionar un préstamo el cuas es para comprar viveres tales como arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc. Su objetivo a mediano plazo es hacer mas visible el negocio a los clientes para esto deberá contruir y hacerlo mas grande.
texts.en:
Three years ago, Miryan took advantage of a bonus she received to start her own business. She manages a food pantry that has a little bit of everything in terms of provisions. Miryan says she feels very productive in her business since she is able to help with the household expenses. She is a single mother and has four children who are excellent public school students.

She wakes up very early so that she can send her children to school before managing her food pantry. Miryan has not encountered any problems in her line of work. At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy provisions such as rice, canned goods, beverages, and other items. Her goal in the midterm is to make her business more visible to customers so that it will can get bigger.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Gladis Guillermina

texts.es:
Gladis nació en el departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Gladis tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene dos hijos. 

Gladis vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es secretaria y trabaja en un colegio particular. Ya son 26 años que se dedica al trabajo y le va muy bien. En sus horas Libres Gladis se dedica a la venta cosméticos.  
 
En esta oportunidad Gladis requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, collares, aretes y otras cosas más.    

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone IV” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Gladis was born in Cusco Department.  Currently, she’s 51 years old, married and has two children.  Gladis lives in the same city where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  She’s a secretary at the El Carmelo private school.  She’s been working for 26 years and does very well.  In her free time she sells cosmetics.

On this occasion, Gladis needs the loan to buy merchandise like perfume, necklaces, earrings and other things.

The “Comuzone IV” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is here.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like perfume, necklaces, earrings and others.

loans.name: Nicholas Ngima

texts.en:
Nicholas is 33 years old and married to a businesswoman. The couple has a six month old and a six year old. Nicholas and his wife hope to educate their children to the university level. For the past three years, he has operated a clothing business in a residential area known as Imara Daima and he is served by the Kitengela branch. Nicholas says that his business is profitable and his major business challenge is inflation leading to high prices of goods. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. Nicholas describes himself as very hardworking. 

Nicholas is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy curtains to sell to his customers. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and locate his own business premises so he will not need to pay rent.

loans.use: to purchase curtains to sell

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Américo, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, por la buena atención y servicio que se le brinda, dándole los prestamos en un plazo corto, los cuales ha invertido en el negocio, por el momento comprara pollo, arroz, carne, condimentos y otros productos para el negocio.
Con los préstamos su condición en el negocio ha mejorado, también los ingresos han sido mayores.
texts.en: Américo decided on a new loan given the level of care and attention that it gives him, offering him short-term loans, which he has invested in his business. For the moment he will buy chicken, rice, meat and seasonings and other products for the business. With the loans his status in the business has improved as has the income which has been greater.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, meat and seasonings.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is 48 years old. He is married with four children. Arnulfo has a motorcycle that is used for transport. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials like tires and oil to use for maintenance. Arnulfo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Arnulfo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for maintenance, like tires and oil

loans.name: Baasanhuu

texts.en:
Baasanhuu is 37 years old, and lives with his wife and two kids in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His two kids are college students. 

He started his grocery retail business in 2007 by renting a shop. Now that the Mongolian economy is booming, he needs to renew his products and repair his shop in order to keep up with the growth. He is a sharp and diligent man who says "People are demanding more healthy and expensive products, therefore I need to renew my range of products completely". He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more grocery products.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sel

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 36 years old and a single mother of two.  She runs a pub to earn a living.  She has four years of experience in the business and has employed two people.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has really grown her business, and wants to thank Faulu Kenya for training her in business management skills. Her desire is to expand her business premises so as to accommodate more customers.  She needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy crates of soda and beer.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet is a 38-year-old mother of five children, all of whom are still living with the family. They work in the rice field and they work for others. She is a farmer in the rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She also plants cassava to generate additional income. She has been farming on her rice field for 12 years and planting cassava for 5 years. Yet can earn around six US dollars per day to feed her family. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy cassava trees for her plantation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to grow more cassava and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cassava trees for her plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora  Sonia es una señora trabajadora, humilde con muchas ganas de trabajar y darle una mejor  vida a su familia.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Juan a quien quiere por el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante.
Ella se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace siete años.
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  quienes la ayudan a la elaboración de pan  para que doña Sonia  no se canse tanto.
Ella pidió el  préstamo para la compra de harina, mateva, royal.mantequilla, huevos para la elaboraciones  pan.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir trabajando y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking, humble woman, eager to work and to give her family a better life.

She is happily married to Juan who has given her support in order to succeed. She has been selling bread for 7 years. Sonia has 3 children who help her prepare the bread so that she does not wear herself out. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy flour, pastry mats, jelly, butter, and eggs for the preparation of bread. She is thankful to the foundation for the support it has given so she can continue to work and offer a better future to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to make bread

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is 37 years old. She is married and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. Her husband supports the family by selling drinking-water filters.

Khanh runs a business selling beverages, which she began eight years ago. The income from this activity helps her to feed her children and maintain their living conditions. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages to meet her customers' needs. 

She hopes her business will be successful and enable her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of beverages to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn is a farmer. She grows papayas, bananas, and tomatoes on her farmland in the village where she lives and sells her products to a middleman who comes to buy them at her home. Yorn is a widow mother with three sons and three daughters.

Yorn requested a Kiva loan few times already. She hopes to continue her farming business because it’s a business she has been in for more than 30 years. That’s why she applied for another loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to continue her farming business by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old. She is married to Sospeter and they have two children. She raises poultry for resale at their farm in Kosirai. Her business has been in operation for two years, and she earns a monthly income of 8,500 KES.

She is requesting her first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more poultry specifically for egg production.  The profits will be used to increase the number of poultry in the farm and to repay the loan. Her hopes are to venture into large-scale farming and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry

loans.name: Mumbi

texts.en:
Mumbi is a 57 year old married woman.  She has 6 children ranging in age from 20 years to 39 years.  She describes herself to be social and talkative. 

She operates a retail stall where she sells juice, sodas, bread, wheat flour, salt, maize flour, beans etc.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Her business is located at a comercial area and her primary customers are repeat and new ones.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour and cooking fat.  Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Wilfer De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilfer se una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Wilfer actualmente se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, actividad que aprendió gracias a que su padre se ha dedicado a esta y este le enseñó. Wilfer tiene en su cultivo una gran variedad de productos, lo que hace que sea reconocido entre sus clientes y esto le permita tener muy buenas ventas. Wilfer ha tenido el gran inconveniente de los fuertes cambios del clima, lo que hace que sus cultivos se vean fuertemente golpeados a la hora de crecer. Es por esto que Wilfer busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de abonos, semillas, insecticidas y fungicidas, para sacar su cultivo adelante.

Wilfer espera que de esta manera su cultivo crezca de la mejor calidad y pueda ofrecerlo a un buen precio. Sueña con poder cultivar en un terreno propio, pues en el que cultiva actualmente es de sus padres y por esto esta ahorrando y trabajando fuertemente para poder hacerse a su propio terreno.

loans.use: Compra de abonos, semillas, insecticidas y fungicidas, para sacar su cultivo adelante.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 5 children. For the past 20 years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar and salt. 

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, like cooking oil,mize flour and sugar for resale, and it will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a whole sale  shop further. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Elizabeth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, like cooking oil,mize flour and sugar for resale,

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr: Tété âgée de 38 ans, n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Tété est mariée à un couturier du nom de Yekini. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tété vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple.  Pour cette raison, Tété vend depuis quatre ans, de la nourriture. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Tété achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Tété sollicite pour une sixième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, l'huile végétale et des condiments.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married with two children and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from general store.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
In the city of Escobedo lives Celia, she is married and is mother of 3 children of 19, 14, and 12 years of age. Her husband works as a driver for a company but his salary is small compared with the many expenses they have, such as schooling for the children and various monthly bills that they have. Given this situation Celia decided to help her husband to actively contribute to the financial well being of her family, which is why she started selling used clothing, with the objective of earning some extra income. With great effort and hard work Celia has realized her own success, now that she is able to provide her children with the education they need, giving them a more promising future.

Now she requires a loan of $275 that she will use to purchase more merchandise and increase her earnings and cover some of the costs she acquired when moving from place to place selling clothes. Do not wait any longer. Your generosity can bew of great help. Remember that she now needs you and that she thanks you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Escobedo vive Celia, es casada y es madre de 3 hijos, de 19, 14 y 12 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como chofer en una empresa, pero su sueldo es muy poco, comparado con los fuertes gastos que tienen que enfrentar, como en las colegiaturas de la escuela de sus hijos y los diversos pagos mensuales y semanales que hay que hacer de los servicios. Por esta situación Celia decidió ayudar a su esposo y contribuir activamente a l bienestar económico de su familia, por ello inició a vender ropa usada, con el objetivo de obtener algunos ingresos extras. El gran esfuerzo y trabajo que Celia ha realizado ha sido exitoso, pues ahora pude brindarle a todos sus hijos la educación que requieren y por ende un futuro más prometedor.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad $ 275 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y poder de esta manera incrementar sus ganancia y solventar algunos de los gastos de traslado a los lugares de donde compra las pacas de ropa usada. No lo dudes más, tu generosidad puede ser gran ayuda, recuerda que ella te necesita ahora y te lo agrdece sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice would like to buy 4 bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio sells milk from his cows to a commercial dairy called Pil Andina. He also works as a chauffeur to supplement his income and support his family. He lives in Achacachi -Tipampa, about two hours from La Paz. He would use his loan to buy another dairy cow to increase his yield of cow's milk. This is his first loan from IMPRO, which rates him as a very good loan risk.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Remigio es productor de leche de vaca, la misma que Remigio comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); el también trabaja como chofer y asi completa los ingreso con los que mantiene a su familia. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos hora de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born on June 12, 1964 in Boulo Kpéta in the County of Zio, Madame A. Akossiwa Cécile is a seamstress. Because of her parents poverty, she abandoned her studies very early on (elementary level) to go in apprenticeship. She became a seamstress after 3 years of training but was not able to open a shop because of lack of funds.

Married and the mother of two (2) children, to be able to cope, she is compelled to supplement her sewing job by working in the fields. But the situation is becoming more and more difficult and she is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy two more sewing machines and other sewing materials. The financing of this activity will ensure an income allowing her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

. Née le 12 juin 1964 à Bolou Kpéta dans la préfecture du Zio, Madame A. Akossiwa Cécile est couturière de profession. A cause de la pauvreté de ses parents, elle abandonna très tôt les études (cours primaires) pour aller en apprentissage. Elle devient couturière après 3 ans de formation mais n’est pas parvenu à ouvrir un atelier par manque de moyen.

Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle est obligée de joindre à sa couture les travaux champêtres pour pouvoir s’en sortir. Mais la situation devenant de plus en plus difficile, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d’acheter deux machines à coudre et autres matériels de couture. Le financement de cette activité lui assurera un revenu pouvant lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 sewing machines and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: I am Rukhsana G. and the mother of an only daughter, who is too young to go to school. I am uneducated but I hope that the same fate does not befall my daughter. I stitch clothes on order from my neighborhood whereas my husband sells cows in a nearby livestock market. He is able to earn a profit of $ 30 to $35 on every cow he sells but he is able to buy and sell only three cows a month. Now my husband wants to buy another animal (cow) to increase his income. I will also pool in my savings and require a loan of USD 250 for my husband.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria lives in the city of El Alto in the zone called Rio Seco, with her husband and five children ages 20, 18, 15, 13, and 10. Her husband works for the city of La Paz. Victoria is the owner of a small shop where she offers photocopying services. The loan will be used to repair the photocopy machine. This is her first loan with Impro and her evaluation shows that she is qualified to receive the funds.

Victoria vive en la calle Julián Apaza de la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 20,18,15,13,10 años respectivamente. Su esposo trabaja como empleado publico en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de repuestos para la reparación de fotocopiadora, pues ella es dueña de una pequeña tienda donde presta este servicio de fotocopias. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO REPAIR THE PHOTOCOPY MACHINE SHE HAS IN HER SMALL SHOP

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala is a widowed woman of 67 years. She is a member of Papauta centre. She is one of the longest standing members at the Papauta centre. She runs a sewing business by herself from her own house. She sews three to four puletasi (traditional Samoan garments worn by women) a day. She earns about $200.00-250.00 WST ($80-100.00 USD) a week. She is applying for this loan so she can buy another sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Since childhood, Jane M. has wanted to own big boutique in Lugazi. She opened up a small shop in 1993 which has grown steadily with time. To date, Jane’s shop is worth $2300 and she has been able to build a permanent house to live in.

Jane is married to a very hard working man who is also supportive. She is 49 years of age and has five children and two dependents. Jane’s business helps support her family and place her children in good schools.

Jane has good taste in clothing for both women and men, a rare talent in women. Her clothes are bought very fast and in one month she replenishes her stock at least three times. It is her wish to access more funding to cut the transportion costs as well as maintain the right stock levels.

loans.use: Jane wants to buy a box of ladies clothing and shoes

loans.name: Kazi Za Jamii B Group

texts.en:
Husna J., age 30, is married with 5 children (ages 15, 11, 8, 4 and 3). She has a charcoal business which she began 8 years ago. Her business is open from 7am to 6pm daily, making her a monthly profit of around $61.

In the past, Husna has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business and she also opened a small nursery school. She hopes for a new loan to increase capital. She will share this loan with her sub-group members dealing in charcoal sales, food sales, pharmacy and a shop.

In the picture, Husna is second from left (back row).

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Y. Shavkat is 39 years old. He is married with four kids; the youngest just started school the last year.

Shavkat sells cattle. He started his business in 2002; at that time, he sold one calf per week. Now Shavkat is selling more. In an average he is making up to $115.00 per month. The business requires much effort, but does generate enough income to provide for Shavkat's family. He gets up every morning at five o’clock to feed and look after the animals.
Shavkat requests 450.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. The loan is required for purchasing fodder for the cattle. Shavkat has a positive credit history and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder for the animals

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Mr. Rene P. lives in his own home with his wife and children on E Street in the Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. He is currently studying law and works as a paralegal in a law office, but he set up a general store, which his wife runs, in his home.

He is requesting this loan in order to increase his capital and restock his store, since there aren’t many general stores in his area. He would like to purchase more goods, offer a wider selection of products to his customers in the area, and increase his profits.

He has a good history, which qualifies him for a new loan. Rene has been our customer since 1999, which demonstrates his commitment to our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rene vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle E de la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; Rene estudia derecho y trabaja como procurador en una consultora pero en su casa instaló una tienda de abarrotes la cual administra su esposa.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y llenar de más productos la tienda ya que por la zona donde vive no hay muchas tiendas de abarrotes y lo que quiere es surtir sus productos, ofrecer mayor variedad a los clientes de la zona y mejorar sus ingresos.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Rene es cliente nuestro desde el año 1999, lo cual demuestra su lealtad a nuestra institución.

loans.use: Purchase of more general store goods

loans.name: Jorge Homero

texts.es:
Jorge is married with three small children. His wife is a housewife. He drives his own bus and the other two he owns are driven by his drivers. Jorge bought his first bus six years ago. Before that he had been a driver, but he decided to go out on his own and buy his own buses.

Jorge needs a $500 loan that he will repay in six months to repair one of his buses which is in need of repair. With your help, Jorge will continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge esta casado, su esposa se dedica al hogar, tiene tres hijos pequeños, el personalmente conduce su autobús y los otros dos que posee lo hacen sus choferes. Comenzó hace 6 años cuando compro su primer autobús, el anteriormente era chofer, pero decidió independizarse y comprar sus propios autobuses.

El necesita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para la reparación de uno de ellos ya que en este momento necesita repara ración. Con tu apoyo Jorge continuara con su negocio.

loans.use: Repair of One of his Buses

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina baji, wife of R. A., lives in Pak Pattan, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 10 years. She is a mother of four children: three daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. Her husband is a tailor. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Her daily income is $2 to $3. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah. Now she is applying for a loan for her husband, who want to buy a sewing machine.

She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Naziran baji, who wants a loan for her garments business; Nusrat baji wants a loan for her food business; Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for her juicer machine; Maryam baji wants a loan to expand her barber salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Yiriwa (Progress). Group

texts.fr:
Members of the Yiriwa group are married women with an average of 20 years of age and 4 children. They live with their husbands and children in polygamous families in Sikouna 2, a village in the Fana area of Koulikoro in Mali. The Yiriwa group is involved in the breeding and the sale of livestock products (sale of live animals, butter, fresh milk, yogurt, curdled milk, etc). This group of Peulh women (a semi-nomadic people of West Africa specialized in the breeding of cattle), bound through ethnic and linguistic but also family ties, decided to borrow together from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first group loan. With this loan, they would like to build their supplies of cattle food and medication at the veterinary pharmacies in Fana, Marka coungo and Santiguila. They usually sell the livestock and products for cash on market days in these cities, and their business runs year round. In addition to the breeding, some of them sell various articles such as flour. Each member of the group hopes to have a monthly profit of 7.500FCFA which will be used to build their capital.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Yiriwa sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 20 ans et 4 enfants .Elles vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans de familles polygames à Sikouna 2 un village de Fana Région de Koulikoro République du Mali. Le groupe Yiriwa fait de l’élevage et la vente des sous produits de l’élevage (La vente d’animaux sur pied, le beurre de vache, le lait frais, le Yaourt et le lait caillé etc.). Ce groupe de femmes Peulh (une ethnie semi nomade de l’Afrique de l’Ouest spécialisée dans l’élevage de bétail) lié par des relations non seulement ethnique et linguistique mais aussi des liens de parenté et d’alliance a décidé d’emprunter ensemble à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Avec ce prêt elles comptent se ravitailler en médicaments et aliments pour bétail dans les pharmacies vétérinaires à Fana, Marka coungo et Santiguila. Elles effectuent leurs ventes (Animaux sur pied et sous produits de l’élevage) généralement les jours de foire de ses mêmes localités au comptant.. Cette activé est menée durant toute l’année. En plus de l’élevage certaines d’entre elles font le petit commerce de divers articles : arachide farine de niébé produits de cueillette. Chaque membre du groupe espère avoir un bénéfice de 7.500FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé à renforcer le capital.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle medication and food

loans.name: Mariam's Harakati Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children between the ages of 9 and 22. She has owned her own fruits store since 2002. Every day, she begins work at 8AM and finishes at 7PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $40.

In the past, Mariam has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mariam now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Salma, Rahel and Veronica, who have businesses dealing with food sales.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for her business.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen S., 37, has been employed as garment factory worker since 2005. She makes a profit of US$3 per day. Her husband, Chea Tep, 43, is a rice farmer, but his farm is just to support the family from day to day. He also works as a fisherman and sells his catch to the market to earn approximately US$3 per day. Fishing is not stable. He does not have enough fishing tools and sometime he catches few fish. This couple has five children, two of whom are employed and three other who are students. Yen wants her children to get a bachelor degree rather than work as farmers. Farmers use a lot of labor but make little profit. She is asking a loan from Kiva to purchase more fishing tools for her husband. This will allow her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.fr: Godwin A. est un conducteur de taxi moto depuis 2 ans à Womé , un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 42 ans, Godwin est marié te père de 4 enfants. La moto qu’il conduit n’étant pas de sa propriété, il désire avec ce crédit s’acheter son propre engin afin de mieux gagner et épargner pour satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Godwin A. has been a driver of motorcycle taxi for 2 years in Womé, a village located about 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Godwin is 42 years old, married and the father of 4 children. The motorcycle he drives is not his own, he wishes, with this loan, to buy his own machine in order to earn more, and to save, to meet the needs of his family.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 28 años, es soltera, vive en casa de su familia. Gracias a sus dones en la cocina, ha logrado poner su puesto ambulatorio de venta de Ceviche, negocio que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, ya que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.
Siendo el ceviche un plato muy cotizado en el Perú por su rico sabor, su venta es asegurada, es así que al día termina todo lo preparado sin sobrarle nada. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la preparación del plato que requiere de mucha dedicación para que salga con el sabor adecuado, pero Carmen lleva 5 años de experiencia que hacen que la clientela se vaya muy contenta después de haber degustado este riquísimo plato. Carmen se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA.  Con el dinero comprará algunos instrumentos de cocina, mayor cantidad de pescado y otros ingredientes para preparar este delicioso plato.
texts.en:
Carmen is 28 years old, single, and lives in her family’s home. Thanks to her talents in the kitchen, she has managed to set up her own cart in which she sells ceviche—citrus-marinated fish. This business generates good profits for her because she works from very early in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. Because ceviche is a very popular dish in Peru due to its delicious flavor, her sales are guaranteed, which is why at the end of the day, she sells everything she has prepared without having anything left over. The most difficult aspect of her job is preparing the dish, which requires a lot of dedication so that the flavor comes out just right. Nevertheless, Carmen has 5 years of experience, which means that her customers leave satisfied after tasting this mouth-watering dish. This is Carmen’s first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. With this loan, she will purchase kitchen utensils, a greater quantity of fish, and other ingredients necessary to prepare this delectable dish.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen utensils, fish, and other ingredients

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica J. is 55 years old and married with four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Her husband works in a hotel. 

She sells foodstuffs in a busy market situated in Benin City. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 local currency to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Len Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people who live in Spean Pau village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan group. Mrs. S. Len P. is the village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small store where she sells grocery products in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. C. Reth, is a fisherman who catches fish locally. Mrs. S. Len P. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is five years old and too young to work or study. Mrs. Sarom C. husband is shown in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: Buy additional grocery products for inventory.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa K. is a 43 year old local restaurant operator. She is married and has five children. Three of them attend school while the remaining two are learning a trade in glazing work. Yaa lives at Abuakwa, a suburb of Kumasi in the Ashanti region. She has lived there since she started her local restaurant. Yaa's husband is very supportive and provides the basic needs of the family.   

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals she has attracted many customers in the area where she serves. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food delivering service. That was when we visited her at her local restaurant. 

Yaa says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the assistnce of a loan to enable her meet her production expenses. With the loan, she wants to purchase more supplies like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. Yaa belongs to a village bank called Charity. She hopes to receive a loan of GH¢450 to make business expand by restocking her inventory. This would enable her  to save more to support the husband in taking care of the Children 's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy supplies like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Née en 1951 à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs, Madame N. Ayaba a pour activité principale  la vente des poissons fumés. Avec six personnes en charge, elle vit au jour le jour avec les maigres recettes de son activité qu’elle exerce depuis 20 ans avec un système traditionnel qui consiste à prendre le poisson à crédit chez les pêcheurs et payer ces derniers après la vente. Ce qui ne lui permet de faire une bonne affaire et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
L’expérience de tontine et de crédit qu’elle a entreprises lui donne peu à peu une autonomie financière et c’est dans le but de payer désormais comptant les poissons, multiplier sa production et augmenter ses recettes qu’elle sollicite un crédit  pour fabriquer de nouveaux fours et grilles nécessaires à la réussite de ses activités. Le financement de ce projet contribuera  à réduire sensiblement l’état de misère de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1951 in Agbanakin in the Lacs prefecture, Madame Ayaba N.’s main line of business is selling smoked fish. She is responsible for six people, and she lives from hand to mouth on the meager income generated by the business that she has run for the last 20 years. She uses the traditional system of buying fish on credit from the fishermen and paying them back after selling the fish. This is not a good deal for her and does not allow her to support her family. Her experience with tontines(a group savings/investment system) and loans has, little by little, given her some financial independence. Her aim from now on is to pay for the fish with cash, increase her fish production and thus her income. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy the new ovens and grills she needs to make her business a success. The financing of this project will considerably reduce her family's poverty.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell smoked fish

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma G. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Wilma is 29 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Saffiatu

texts.en: This is Saffiatu K., who was born in Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age 34, married with three children. Saffiatu sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for over five years now. With this loan, Saffiatu will expand her business. She will buy two bales of second-hand clothes to add to her current stock. This will enable Saffiatu to make more profit, repay her loan, and consequently improve on her standard of living.

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Y. Dilorom is 34 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children.

Dilorom is a market vendor. For the last four years she has been selling cottonseed oil at the local market. In the traditional Tajik cuisine the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil - especially our national dish “Pilaw”, which needs much cottonseed oil in order it to be delicious. So the goods that Dilorom is selling are in strong demand among the population.

Today, Dilorom is planning to increase her business. For this reason she requests $800 for the term of 9 months. Dilorom is counting on your help and thanks you for your support.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more cottonseed oil in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena, tiene un taller de costura donde elabora edredones, cojines y sabanas.
Tiene una hija y esta separada de su esposo, su actividad económica le ayuda para tener ingresos y poder solventar los gastos de alimentación, estudios y otros gastos.
Vive en la zona de Bello Horizonte de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa en anticrético.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de una maquina industrial) que mejorará su producción y la calidad de los edredones.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Lorena has a workshop where she makes bedspreads, cushions and bed linens. She has a daughter and is separated from her husband. Her work allows her to earn funds for basic family needs such as food, education and other expenses. She lives in the Bello Horizonte neighborhood of La Paz. She plans to use the loan funds to purchase an industrial sewing machine so that her producion and the quality of her bedspreads will improve. This is the first time she has requested a loan from Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of the bedspreads she manufactures.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie V. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 30 years old. Margie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Margie is just starting this business.

In 2008, Margie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
