Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Margie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Margie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia A. Ally is a Tanzanian married woman and entrepreneur.  She runs a food shop at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of cereal crops such as wheat flour, maize flour, groundnuts, dried beans and also sugar. She purchases her business goods from Kariakoo Market wholesale and also direct from the producers. Business income is used to meet her daily family needs. Her business plan is to run a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Y. is married and has five children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a trader.

Ama cooks and sells beans and gari (a fried cassava dish) at Kormantse near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1999. She uses her income to feed her family and also to pay her children’s school fees. She will use the loan to increase the capital of her business, enabling her to purchase more fresh beans to be cooked and sold. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh beans to be cooked and sold

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход успешный бизнесмен , очередной кредит получает на покупки муки.  Для производства макарон необходимо  большого количества муки. В его  работников специалисты и, каждому он платит достойную заработную плату. В дальнейшем планирует купить модернизированную технологию, что позволит ему сократить расходы , у уменьшить количество работников. С каждым производством он старается увеличить производительность макаронных изделий что бы оплатить свои долги и оправдать все расходы.  Фарход благодарен за поддержку от КИВА и планирует получить еще повторный кредит.
texts.en:
Farhod is a successful businessman. He is requesting his next loan to purchase flour. A large quantity of flour is needed to manufacture pasta. Farhod’s staff is specialists, and he pays each one of them a decent salary. He plans to purchase modern technology in the future, which will allow him to cut expenses by decreasing his staff. He tries to improve pasta manufacturing all the time in order to repay his debts and justify all the expenses. Farhod is grateful to Kiva for the support and plans to obtain another loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Ketti

texts.es: Ketti tiene 40 años y lo que más desea es brindarles lo necesario a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus 2 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que le tomó varios años conseguir. Sus ganas de progresar la llevaron a desempeñarse en múltiples actividades, siendo una de ellas ser miembro de la Policía Municipal, quienes se caracterizan por el cuidado y orden dentro de los mercados. Por otro lado, vendía abarrotes, pero este negocio fracasó porque se trasladó a otro distrito de su ciudad, lo cual la obligó a cambiar de rubro de trabajo, siendo la venta de ropa una de sus mejores opciones. Ahora está iniciando este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus amistades, quienes la motivan, además sabe que sus contactos dentro del mercado beneficiarán su desarrollo. La prioridad actual de Ketti es crecer con esta actividad a base de mucha responsabilidad y esfuerzo, pues quiere empezar su negocio con suma eficiencia, ya que su anhelo a futuro es obtener un puesto donde pueda vender grandes cantidades de productos diversos. Este es su 14avo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera que en su banco comunal sigan trabajando con las mismas ganas y esmero por su progreso como grupo organizado. Los 3000 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán adquirir la mercadería que requiere para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Ketti is 40 years old and desires to provide for her family’s basic needs. She lives with her husband and 2 children in a house that took several years to build. Ketti has multiple sources of income. She is a member of the municipal police force, who are known for being watchful and preserving order in the marketplace.

At one time she sold groceries, but that business failed because she moved to another district within the city. She was forced to change her line of work, so selling clothes appeared to be the best option. Ketti started her business with the support of friends who motivated her. She also knew a few contacts in the market who could help her business develop. With great responsibility and effort, her main priority is to generate more activity. She then wants to start operating her business more efficiently because she hopes to start selling larger quantities of different products in the future.

This is Ketty’s 14th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She hopes that her communal bank will continue to work with the same amount of enthusiasm, dedication and organization. She is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase merchandise for her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adebowale

texts.en: Adebowale is 50 years old and married. She has a shop where she sells medicine and drinks. She is requesting the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more medicine and drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: M. Mary is 44 years old and a widow with 6 children aged between 22 – 8 years and all still in school. She also takes care of 3 orphans. Mary is a business lady and a matooke dealer who buys her produce from villages to her stall in Kyeizinga I for 8 years so far and she is mostly affected by the poor roads making transportation difficult. She is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week and this is basically with the good customer care and the loans that help to increase stock. She has a dream of opening up a retail shop in addition to her current business as well as continue educating her children. She needs a loan to help pay school fees for her children as well as restock her business with more produce.

loans.use: Paying school fees for the children and buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.en:
Hilarion is 26 years old and has a common-law wife and a son who is two. For the past five years he has been working with his father in both bricklaying and agriculture. While Hilarion primarily spends his time working as a bricklayer, he dedicates his weekends to cultivating yucca, citrus fruits and other crops.

Hilarion has requested a loan from CIDRE (Centro de Investigation y Desarrollo Regional, or Regional Center for Research and Development) that will be used to expand his cultivation of citrus fruits on his farm. Recently, he bought a plot of land in an urban area where he is constructing a home. Hilarion hopes this loan will help him to increase his earnings so he will be able to finish construction on his home and so raise his family's quality of life.

This loan is located in the Chapare region of Bolivia’s Cochabamba Department. Chapare is Bolivia's largest producer of coca used for illegal cocaine production. Part of CIDRE's mission in Chapare is to give low-interest loans to both incentivize and encourage these farmers to cultivate alternative crops rather than coca. Alternative-to-coca programs like CIDRE's help ensure that these farmers will be incorporated into a legally regulated and consequently more sustainable sector of the economy.

loans.use: To his expand cultivation of citrus fruits

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariam is twenty-eight years old. She is single and currently lives in a single room apartment. She is a trader; more specifically, she trades in jeans, blouses, skirts, children's clothes, et cetera. She has been in business for the last year. Her working capital was provided by her friend, but it is not adequate for her business. She is no longer able to purchase high quality products. She believes that the loan will help her be able to purchase a lot of good quality merchandise, which in turn will lead to more sales. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, ladies wear and slippers to increase her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchasing jeans, ladies wear and slippers

loans.name: Umarali

texts.en:
K. Umarali is 40 years old. He is married with three children. Umarali sells men's clothing. Thirteen years ago he started as a seller. Gradually, he saved some money, sold his car, and started his own business. Now he is a very experienced entrepreneur and manages his business trying to keep his clients happy. The business is successful and generates a stable income for the family. Today Umarali is requesting $800 US dollars for the purchase of new men's clothing to sell. Umarali thanks everyone supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new men's clothing to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.en: This committee was formed by Pascuala G., who invited her neighbors to participate in the program and join the group with the goal of working to offer their children a better lifestyle. There are 15 independent women in this group who sell clothes, food, and cleaning supplies. Each woman uses her  share of the loan to buy goods for sale such as sugar, flour, eggs, milk, meat, and soft drinks, as well as jeans, shirts, skirts, shirts, lingerie, and raw fabric and materials to sew articles of clothing.

loans.use: To purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora  AURORA V. C. , tiene  34 años, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to. de secundaria y tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a  la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò ropa para damas  como: jeans, polos, blusas, pantalones, sàbanas, edredones, etc. 
Con su próximo crédito de 1,100 nuevos soles viajarà a la ciudad de Lima a comprar ropa como: vestidos, polos, faldas, jeans, polos, blusas, pijamas, etc. 
Ella sueña con adecuar un espacio en su domicilio en donde pueda exhibir la ropa que venderá.
texts.en:
Aurora V. C. is 34. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the Siempre Adelante II Communal Bank. She went to school until the fifth year of high school. She has three children who are economically dependent upon her. She sells clothes for women, men, and children. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought women’s clothes like jeans, polo shirts, blouses, pants, sheets, and quilts, etc. With her next loan for 1,100 PEN she will travel to the city of Lima to buy clothes like dresses, polo shirts, skirts, jeans, blouses, and pajamas, etc. She dreams of adapting a space in her home where she could display the clothes that she will sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel to the city of Lima to buy clothes like dresses, polo shirts, skirts, jeans, blouses, and pajamas, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe C. lives in the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old, married and has nine school-aged children. She makes a living by buying and selling ocean-caught fish to people who live in her community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ceneza

texts.en:
Ceneza T. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Ceneza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ceneza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ceneza is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ceneza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Ceneza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her shop. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa T. is 34 years of age and is a new member of ASHI. She is married and has five children, whose age range is from 12 to 20.  Ninfa joined ASHI hoping that by having her own business, and with the use of a loan, she could make her dream of a better life for her family come true. She is now qualified to receive a second loan through ASHI after successfully repaying her previous loan.

The first step she took to achieve her aspirations was to partner with her husband in his fishing business. Since her husband’s livelihood is their main source of daily income, she wants to support its growth. She wants to provide for the needs of her children, especially those who have not gone and those who cannot go to college. Ninfa knows that their having a better paying and stable job anchors on the income from the business. 

Presently, Ninfa is not yet profiting a great deal from their business because her husband is not in control of his fishing schedule. He only borrows his neighbor's fishing boat when it is not in use. As a result, Ninfa can sell the fish and make an income only on an irregular basis. 

Ninfa is requesting a much larger loan so that she can buy a fishing boat for her husband. Once they have their own boat, they can improve their income and better provide their children’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for their fishing and fish-selling business.

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esta señora es trabajadora desde hace cinco años de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa, se desempeña como conserje en el palacio de la cultura, es madre soltera con 5 hijos bajo su cargo y en edad escolar.
La señora trabaja con Ceprodel desde el año 2006, se le han financiado para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último es para gastos personales (medicina).
texts.en:
She has worked for the past 5 years for Chichigalpa's mayor's office as a caretaker at the Palace of Culture; she is a single mother of 5 school-age children, whom she supports. She has collaborated with Ceprodel since 2006 and has had loans for home improvements. This most current loan is for personal expenses (medicine).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses: medical and others.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Teresa,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia D. Urubamba ubicada en el departamento D. Cusco a 1 hora D. la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años D. edad, la socia es soltera, nuestra socia es una joven emprendedora, ella es muy carismática y nos cuenta que el ejemplo D. sus padres la llevó a ser cada vez mejor ser humano; Nuestra socia trabaja desD. hace 13 años en la empresa D. artesanía ubicada en el pleno corazón del valle sagrado D. los inkas, está empresa es exportadora y realiza bellísimos trabajos en arcilla, es una empresa bien consolidada y D. acabados D. altísima calidad, Nuestra socia se siente feliz D. seguir laborando en esta empresa que le ha dado la oportunidad D. crecer y aprender muchísimo, ella podría abrir su propia empresa D. artesanías, pero una cuestión D. lealtad a sus jefes no le permite hacerlo al menos No en los siguientes años; Nuestra socia al contrario con sus ahorros D. pago D. está su empresa abrió una discoteca bar para turistas en pleno centro D. Urubamba, le puso el nombre D. Forastero; Nuestra socia ahora solicita el préstamo para mejorar el local D. su discoteca y comprar luces y sonidos D. mejor y mayor capacidad, comprar una televisión.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the communal bank "Los Solidarios." She lives in the Urubamba province, located in the Cusco department, one hour from the city of Cusco. Teresa is 32 years old and single. She is a young entrepreneur who is very charismatic, and she tells us that the example of her parents led her to become a better human being. For 13 years she has worked in a handicraft company located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas. This company is an exporter and makes beautiful works in clay. It is a well-established company and its finished products are of the highest quality. Teresa feels content to continue working for this company that has given her the opportunity to grow and learn a lot. She could open her own handicraft company, but would not do this due to her loyalty to her bosses, at least not in the near term. On the contrary, with her savings from this work, Teresa opened a nightclub bar for tourists in downtown Urubamba, named Forastero. Teresa now requests a loan to improve the premises of her nightclub: to buy lights and sound to improve the quality, to expand the capacity, and to buy a television set. Teresa is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and she is committed to make each of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve her nightclub bar: to buy lights and sound to improve the quality, to expand the capacity, and to buy a television set.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza S. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at wholesale and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Eliza is 47 years old and is married to a watchman. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifan is from the small city of Raiwind in Pakistan. She has a very friendly nature and always keeps a smile on her face. While she is not an educated lady, she has good talking skills and good understanding.
Hanifan has owned and operated a grocery shop in the community for over three years. She enjoys handling her grocery shop and keeps herself busy in it. Her husband, M. A., works in a local factory for a meager income. Hanifan's business allows her to meet the financial expenses of the family.
Currently she is requesting a loan to buy more groceries, such as lentils, cooking oil and spices, for the expansion of her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy goods for grocery shop

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
la sra. Amanda E. P. es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta produccion y venta de tortillas, en las tardes despues de todas las ventas de tortillas se dedica a vender golosinas en el barrio de Monjaras. Amanda esta casada con el señor Santos Douglas Varela quien se dedica a la construccion y con quien han procreado 7 hijos de los cuales 5 aun dependen de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas y otros alimentos para hacer las golosinas, Amanda espera que todo le salga bien para seguir trabajando y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amanda E. P. is a hard-working person who manufactures tortillas for sale. In the afternoon, when the tortilla sales are over, she sells snacks in Monjaras neighborhood. She’s married to Santos Douglas Varela who is a construction worker; they have 7 children, 5 of which still depend on them. She will use the requested funds to buy supplies and ingredients needed to make tortillas and other items to make snacks. Amanda hopes that things will end favorably so that she can continue working and providing a better quality of life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lime powder, water, beans, lard, spices, pork, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Marina Edith

texts.es: Marina Edith Q. M. de 54 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para niños y niñas, la cual comercializa en las diferentes plazas de Santa Tecla así como también en el departamento de San Miguel y Usulután al oriente del país. Marina vive junto a tres hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad y se dedican a trabajar, el menor de 20 años de edad, trabaja junto a  Marina y es quien se dedica de cargar la ropa por todos los lugares que la venden, lo cual es una gran ayuda para Marina ya que de esta manera pueden recorrer más colonias y plazas vendiendo la ropa. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior en diferentes estilos los cuales no posee y que puedan llamar más la atención de los niños de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marina Edith Q. M. is 54 years old and resides in the city of Santa Tecla, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She sells undergarments for boys and girls at different sites throughout Santa Tecla, as well as the Departments of San Miguel and Usulután in the eastern part of the country. Marina lives with her three adult children who are involved in their work. Her oldest child is 20 years old and helps her with transporting the clothes to all the places where she sells them. This has been a great help to Marina because it allows her to travel to more places to generate sales.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of undergarments in different styles that she does not have in stock. This will allow her to serve more children and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's undergarments to sell

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es: Juana T. tiene 48 años de edad, casada de oficios Domésticos, tiene 8 hijos y tres únicamente viven con ella, se dedica a la Tejeduría (Elaboración de Cortes Típicos), cuenta con seis empleados y telares, con 25 años de experiencia, recibe un crédito por medio del Banco Comunal denominado LAS TEJEDORAS el cual está conformado por once mujeres creado por ellas mismas, el préstamo lo invertirán como capital de trabajo adquiriendo  materia prima, para incrementar la demanda. Sueña con ver su negocio mucho más grande, que les generé mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana T. is 48 years old and a married homemaker. She has 8 children and only 3 live with her. She works in weaving (making traditional clothing). She has six employees and looms, and 25 years of experience. She is getting a loan from the communal bank called LAS TEJEDORAS (the Weavers), which is made up of eleven women and created by themselves. They will invest the loan in working capital adquiring more raw material, to increase demand. She dreams of seeing her business grow much bigger, and generate more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Evalina

texts.en:
Evalina L. is currently in the business of selling maize and sorghum at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Evalina is 31 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a store for her goods.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Musayeva

texts.en: Musayeva T. is a 38-year-old woman, single, and a poultry breeder.  She has 10 years' experience in poultry breeding. She raises chickens and geese. T. sells her poultry to local farmers and once every two weeks, her father brings her chickens to the livestock bazaar to sell them for a profitable price. T. has applied for 1000 AZN to increase the number of chickens she sells.

loans.use: purchase more poultry

loans.name: Gaston

texts.es: El señor Gastón se dedica a la venta de repuestos de tornería, vive en casa de su esposa con sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el señor esta feliz del Crédito con tasa preferencial kiva,  el Señor  reparte repuestos en motocicleta que le ayuda bastante a reducir los gastos de transporte, reparte por todas las zonas de  la ciudad,  en si recorre toda Cochabamba, esta feliz con kiva por que le ayudo bastante en el negocio que tiene,  es una persona trabajadora que empezó desde muy pequeño con el negocio, el destino del crédito es para poder comprar mas insumos de tornería que ya es muy conocido en el ámbito.
texts.en:
Gastón dedicates himself to the sale of lathing supplies. He lives in his wife's house with his school-aged children. He is happy about Kiva's preferential rate loan. He distributes supplies by motorcycle and that greatly helps reducing transportation costs. He distributes supplies all around town and travels all over Cochabamba. He is happy with Kiva for greatly helping him with his business. He is a hardworking person who started his business really young. The goal of this loan is to purchase more lathing supplies since he is already very well known in his field.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lathing supplies
